title.rendered: A Need For A Revival, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 119:37, “Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things, and revive me in Your way”

Why is there a need for revival? We just had a revival at our church a few weeks ago and I am hearing about another revival I find very strange currently taking place in Florida.

There are three words that work together but each of them have their own strengths. REPLACE is to put back into former position or place, it’s also to provide a substitute. RESTORE is to bring back into existence or use, also to bring back to an original condition. REVIVE which is my key word is to bring back to life or conscious. It’s also to return to validity, effectiveness or operative condition. The three words have functions that sound a like as they talk about bringing back which is a sign to us that something was once there but for some unknown reasons it went dormant, dead, in effective, corrupted, broken. The word revival kind of outweighs the two because it talks more about bringing back to life. You can restore something but still not be able to make a difference, you can replace something and still not do much but when you revive something, you bring it back to life, to its validity, effectiveness and operational condition.

9 times in Psalm 119 the word revive has been recorded. This an indication that at times we go through dormant stages in our Christian walk that leaves us ineffective, dead and without being valid. The cure for this dilemma is not replace or restore but revive, bring back to life. Psalm 119:25, “…Revive me according to your word, Psalm 80:18, “…revive us and we will call upon Your name”, Psalm 119:40, “…Revive me in Your righteousness”, Psalm 119:88, “Revive me according to Your loving kindness”, Psalm 119:149, “…revive me according to your justice”, Psalm 119:156, “…revive me according to Your judgments, Psalm 143:11, “Revive me, O Lord, for Your name’s sake, Isaiah 57:15, “…revive the heart of the contrite ones” Habakkuk 3:2, “revive Your work in the midst of the years“

What causes us to need a revival in the first place? Isaiah 40:27, “… The Creator of the ends of the earth, neither faints nor is weary” Of course God does not change and what affects humans has no effect on Him but for us, we will go through different cycles, times of being up, and times of being down, times of encouragements and times of discouragement why? Isaiah 40:30, “Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall”. It’s clear that each of us will have those seasons for the bible says so but listen to how we get revived, Isaiah 40:31, “But those that WAIT on the Lord shall renew (revive) their strength”. “Wait” as I have always mentioned does not mean sit and do nothing, wait is a word used in restaurants to mean serve. Wait on God means serve the Lord, find something that you can do for the Lord because this is how revival begins to come. Look at how the bible puts it “Shall renew their strength” as opposed to “their strength will be renewed”. What this shows me is that in the process of waking up and beginning to do something in your life to bring a revival, that process will renew (revive) your strength. Here are the results of revival, Isaiah 40:31, “…They shall mount up with wings like eagles (not doves)” Doves would fly away very fast while eagles sow above everything. If you are dealing with struggles, learn by God’s grace to sow above it without trying to run away from it. “They shall run and no be weary” this is not trying to run a way but running towards the mark set before us, this is not a weary race but a race of hope. “They shall walk and not faint“, this is where I would plug in faith, have faith in God without fainting cause faith keeps hope alive. Some people may think revival is all about hearing a fiery preaching, getting slain, basking in the presence of God and all that is good but I am more revived being in the Father’s business. Inquiring of what’s in the heart of the Father and stepping out by faith with His help to serve Him. Where are you today in your spiritual life? what are you doing about it? Get into a revival mode. To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Presence Or Position

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 4:8, “Draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

What is the presence of God all about that Moses desired and so was David and the rest? There is something about His presence that makes one to see and deal with Him and things differently. In Genesis, Jacob had a vision, upon waking up, he said, “The presence of the Lord was here and I knew it not”. Moses said”, “If Your presence is not going with us, do not let us move from here (paraphrased)”. The children of Israel had the ARK of the Covenant which represented the presence of God. The bible calls Him Jehovah Shammah which means Jehovah Present and not absent. He is not coming or going, He is here, now, available, ready.

What is the ARK in the bible? An Ark is something that affords protection and safety, therefore the ARK of God (Covenant) is a throne where Yahweh Himself was present in the midst of His people. The children of Israel cherished the ARK as it was a sign of God present with them. No enemy could subdue them in the presence of the ARK. Understanding the ARK of the Covenant eliminates one from trying to treat Him as a lucky charm or a holy object that you can rub and get whatever you want. He is present and He has His dwelling in our midst and though people who do not know Him think that we are using Him as a lucky charm, they have a wrong understanding. We don’t worship God because of what He does for us, we worship Him because of who He is.

In 1Samuel 4:10, 11, “So the Philistine fought, and Israel was defeated… Also the Ark of God was captured; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phineas, died”. The Philistines came out to capture this thing that was always been with Israelites. They don’t understand what they were messing with. All they cared about was capturing the ARK and having it positioned in their camp as a lucky charm because if it worked for the Israelites, why shouldn’t it work for them. The problem was, they were treating the ARK as an “IT” while the Israelites treated the ARK as Him, a sign of reverence and respect. What finally destroyed Eli is the fact that the Ark of the Covenant was captured. He heard that his two sons had died but that did not nearly affect like when he heard that the ARK was captured which meant that the presence of God had departed. His daughter in law was pregnant at that time, when she heard Israel was defeated, her husband and her brother in law killed and the ARK captured, she immediately gave birth to a child and died. She named the child Ichabod, saying, “the glory of has departed from Israel“. I wonder why the glory, God’s presence departed from Israel. Why has the presence of the Lord left you when you had Him, could feel Him, could talk to Him, you could hear Him. If the presence of the Lord has departed from us, that void has been replaced with Ichabod. Do you have the ARK or Ichabod? I will get into depth about the glory next time, but let’s find out why the glory departed.

1Chronicles 13:4, “And let us bring again the ARK of our God to us: for we inquired not at it in the days of Saul”. David desired the presence of God while Saul desired position. During those times, people desired more of the Spirit, desiring the presence of God, having God fight for them and the more they gained positions (things), the more they began to loose focus and that is why they lost the ARK. Look at Paul speaking, Galatians 3:3, Are you foolish? having begun in the Spirit, and now are made perfect by the flesh?. You lost it because you moved from the Sprit to the flesh, from the presence to the position. David desired to bring back the ARK for they saw where they messed up big time and he desired to fulfill James 4:8, “Draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded”. You and I need draw nigh to God by seeking Him and He will do the same. For us to do so, we need to cleanse our hands, and purify hearts and choose whether we want the presence or the position.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Give Him What He Wants

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 12:32, “And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men unto me” While in school , we were taught the cycle of rain. If I remember correctly, we have the river, ocean, lakes, waters streams or anywhere or anything that has water and the sun warms the water and the water forms water vapors that rises up to the clouds. Later as the clouds gets heavier and heavier the clouds releases the rain. In this I see the giving and receiving and this is what I would like to cover this morning.

No one deserves praises like the Almighty God, He sits on the throne. The bible says, “He inhabits the praise of His people” to which means live in, dwell in, occupy, make a home in, reside in. It may not make sense to you and I but to God it does. He makes dwelling in the midst of our praises. Praises are earned in the lives of men, as for God He hasn’t only earned it, He deserves it. Who else in the world deserves recognition like the one Who was, Who is and is to come, His name is higher than any other, His name is Jesus for He’s created everything. The earth is the Lord’s and the fullness of it. He is Incredible, Awesome, Magnificent, Excellent, Powerful, Glorious, and Sovereign to mention a few. He is no ordinary God, HE IS THE GREAT I AM Who deserves all the praises.

And just like the lakes, the seas, the oceans, and the rivers, we are all like them for there is no one who can say that they have nothing to offer. God has blessed each of us in many ways, a lot has been deposited in our accounts, we have every reason to praise Him. His love, power, provisions, touch, promises have become the things that have been shone in our lives. When you talk about the sun or some type of light, yes they are used to shine the way but at the same time, the lights have some type of
heat that they produce. God has produced His light to guide us but at the same time, His light has produced heat that has warmed our waters (heart, spirit) and we can’t afford to just sit down and do nothing. He has done this that we would raise our vapors of praise to Him. Vapor rises up to the sky and after sometime, the sky releases rain again. The bible says that God rains on the just and the unjust. If you look at what produces vapors, it’s anything that has water in it and has been warmed to a certain point. Remember that not everything contains water but when it rains, it showers on everything including
that which did not produce the vapors. John 12:32, “And if I be lifted up from the earth…” if you will lift up the vapors of praise up to me says the Lord, “I will draw all men unto me…”, I will do marvelous things that will cause even them that do not know me to be drawn”. John 10:38, “But if I do, though you believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in Him”. The vapors go up as the intangible, you might see it but you cannot touch it or
even smell it and it might not make sense as to why someone would want it. To God what seems foolish to you (praises) is what He desires and deserves. When King Jehoshaphat was faced by three huge armies from different kingdoms in 2Chronicles 20, he proclaimed a prayer and fast in the whole of his kingdom.
After prayers, a word from the Lord came to them, 2Chronicles 20:15, “Do not be afraid nor dismayed because of this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but God’s”. They could have stopped there and sat down and waited for the Lord to fight but this is what they did, 2Chronicles 20:18, “And Jehoshaphat… and all the Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem bowed before the Lord, worshiping the Lord, 19, “then the Levites… stood up to praise the Lord God of Israel with voices loud and high“, 21, “And when he had consulted with the people, he appointed those who should sing to the Lord, and who should praise the beauty of His holiness…, 22, “Now when they began to sing and to praise, the Lord set ambushes against the people of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah and they were defeated“. They offered to God vapors of praise and when God saw their praises, He sent the rain by setting an ambush upon the enemy.

In conclusion, we need to be reminded that God wants our vapors of praise to ascend into heavens because He has chosen us for that purpose. We were made to praise Him, love Him in every circumstance 1Peter 2:9, “But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should show forth the praises of Him who hath called you out of darkness into His marvelous light”. We don’t praise Him just because we want to, we praise Him because He wants it and we don’t only praise Him because we have it, we praise Him because of Who He is and not because of what He does. Praise Him in the morning, in the afternoon, in the evening, praise Him every where, praise Him
in every circumstance. Let your vapors of praise reach Him and as you praise Him, He will open the windows of heaven and shower you with the showers of GIVE HIM WHAT HE WANTS!!!

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: How Big is Your God? By Phil, the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

I have a journal called Big Time Prayers for a Big time God. The title is so fitting for the character of God, yet it is not a character trait that most use to describe God, BIG. A little boy is told that the heater bars on a stove are hot and will burn his hand. He believes his parents cognitively. One day while mom is cooking, the little boy is enameled by the glowing colors of the stoves heater bars and reaches out to touch them, as something most little boys have done before. As soon as he touches the heater bars he no longer believes they are hot, HE now KNOWS they are hot. His experience brought him from the realm of cognitive belief, into experiential knowledge. With the pain of the burn, and the smell of his little burnt finger, this boy heard the echo of his parents loud and clear.

That’s what happened to Gideon in Judges chapter 6. Gideon is called by God while he is threshing wheat in the wine press in order to save it from the Midianites. As Gideon is doing this, he receives the call of God upon his life as God calls him “Mighty Warrior.” What a thing to be called by God. What an ironic title for a man with such a timid record. Gideon himself even challenged the validity of such words of himself. Gideon proclaimed that he was from the weakest family, and that he himself was the weakest one of his own family. He felt least qualified for the job. But it is just like our BIG GOD, to use the weak things of this world. God assures Gideon, “I will be with you, and you will strike down ALL the Midianites together.” WOW, He hadn’t really done anything for God yet, but God saw Gideon threshing the Midianites, the way he was threshing the wheat.

God tells Gideon to break down the altar to the false god of Baal, his fathers altar. What Gideon is going to go against his earthly father, the king? Yes, he did for the purposes of his Heavenly Father, The KING of kings!

Gideon builds the altar and proclaims at the altar, Jehovah Shalom, “The Lord is my Peace.” Why, because experientially he saw the angel of God face to face and did not die, but rather peace was the fruit that resulted. Gideon had an EXPERIENCE with our BIG GOD!

Then Gideon does his tests of the Lord’s will with the fleeces, and then after all that God goes and cuts his army from 32,000 men, to 10,000 and then to only 300! Why, because God was going to show Himself BIG! The story goes, as Gideon with 300 gains a BIG victory, because he had a BIG GOD, our GOD as His commanding officer.

What can you point to experientially lately, that you can perhaps appreciate as an attribute of God? BIG perhaps sounds too common for our great God, but yet BIG is so fitting for Him simultaneously. Gideon was called “Mighty Warrior,” what is God calling you experientially lately? God used Gideon to defeat the Midianites, after Gideon’s perception of himself was defeated, what is God calling you to defeat, or gain victory in that He is waiting for you to go in His power and take the land? How BIG is God to you!?!?

Blessings,
Phil, the evangelist <

title.rendered: A Need To Rest

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 2:1-3, ” … Then God blessed the seventh day and satisfied if, because in it He rested…”

In this fast-paced world in which we live, the very thing we need to do is what we often don’t do: We need to simply sit still and open our heart to the counsel of God. Then we will be prepared for whatever the day brings. I’m talking about rest this morning, a struggle to many including myself. There is no one who understands rest like God and we see this being recorded in the book of Genesis 2:1-3, “Thus the heavens and the earth, and all the host of them, were finished. And on the seventh day God ended His work which He had done, and He rested on the seventh day … , Then God blessed the seventh day and satisfied if, because in it He rested…” Rest is very important in one’s life and should never be taken lightly.

Sometimes the most godly thing we can do for ourselves is go to sleep. Forget about what happened today and what you could have done better, take a break from what you dealt with today and shut everything out and get yourself in a position of rest. Applying emergency brakes to a fast moving car will bring the wheels to a rest but the car body will still be in motion and that could make the car flip. I would say that applying the brakes gradually will not only bring the wheels at a rest but the body will also be brought to a rest at the same time. Worrying about what hasn’t happened or what will happen will rob you of peace and rest. The mind needs rest, so is the body and the heart too. Troubled water never settles because of troubling winds but we thank God, He is the quiet still water soothing our souls to sleep.

Jesus comes in later and reminds people of what rest is all about, rest from the burdens of sins.. We know that there can be no true rest outside Christ and the reason is simple, if you are going to rest, you going to have to give up on what is stopping you from resting. In this case, Jesus has offered to take off our hands what we are holding on to that in turn we might have the true rest in Him. He says, “Come to Me” which is an action word meaning move from where you are to where He is, “All you who labor (weary) and are heavy laden (burdened)” this is the reason why you and I need to move, “And I will give you rest” then end result if we do what He ask of us. The main reason for this rest is rest from the burden of sin but has also benefits to the rest in our bodies. If you’ve received rest from your burden of sin, ask for rest for your weary body.

I do believe that you could rest even when working for you are not dealing with things by yourself. Mathew 11:29, “Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me”, Though the text has a unique meaning, I could take a principle and apply it in this was, “take my advise, allow me to help you, let me give you directions and strategies and learn all these things I am teaching you“. The bible says that, “The joy of the Lord is my strength“, and His strength will sustain you, you have a chance to come to Him for rest and energy again. “For I am gentle, and lowly (humble) of heart, and you will find rest for your souls”. I love the way He says it, you could rest your body and not rest your mind but the Lord is giving the total package, He will not scream at you and He will not even put you down all He wants to do is give you the rest you need, hide you under the shadow of His wings like a chicken that covers her chicks. Mathew 11:30, “For My yoke is easy and My burden is light”. The yoke put on the oxen is used to keep the oxen focused, moving towards the same direction but with a purpose and it’s heavy. The Lord is saying, I will take the yoke you are used to and I will give you mine which is easy, I will guide you, I will be on your side and the burden I have for you is very light cause I am carrying yours which is heavy. Who can resist such an offer?

Perhaps the words of the carpenter, promising rest, is so compelling because of our endless desire and quest to rest. Do you want rest? do you know where to find rest? The Father rested and sanctified it, the Son called and offered it, will you choose to receive it? If you want to bring under control a fast paced life style, you must eliminate the unnecessary and concentrate on the necessary by wanting to be where God wants you to be. My soul is at rest, my mind is renewed, there is no greater joy than Him being present.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Freed Indeed

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 8:36, “Therefore if the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed”

I ask myself this question, can born again Christians be demon possessed? This is my conviction, Christians don’t get demon possessed but demon oppressed. What is the difference between the two?, to be possessed is to be owned by someone or to be controlled, dominated, in other words, be a master’s slave. Born again Christians are not owned or mastered by demons, they do not belong to the devil, 1John 4:4, “Ye are of God little children and have overcome them: because greater is He that is in you than he (demons) that is in the world“. We are of God, automatically we have overcome them. Jesus inside of us is an overcome and though we at times don’t need to fight or have no strength to fight, Him present in us is enough to scare the demons. why? James 2:29, “You believe that there is one God; You do well. Even the demons believe and tremble“

Now let’s look at the word “oppressed”. Oppressed is to keep down by severe and unjust use of force or authority. It is to weigh heavily, to overwhelm with an aim to crush. The work of the devil and his demons on Christians is to keep them down, accuse them, use force and authority to make sure he is down. He goes about putting heavy things on the back of Christians to overwhelm them. He is constantly looking for loop holes to come in and oppress but thanks be to God for a strategy to overcome, 1Peter 5:8, “Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil as a roaring lion, walks about seeking souls he may devour”. Being sober is being aware of the tactics of the enemy and when he strikes. Being vigilant is always being alert cause as we have seen, he is always walking about trying to find those who are not sober and vigilant. He is roaring as (like) a lion, that means that he is not the lion but he is doing it like one. This can be looked at in two ways, when he roars like a lion, if you are not careful, you might think that he is the lion and blame Christ for all that you are going through. The bible says, “My sheep knows my voice“ therefore we have to distinguish between who roars like the lion and who is the Lion. Jesus Christ is the LION OF THE TRIBE OF JUDAH!!!

Why is this so important? because we were not called into bondage but into freedom and freedom only comes from and through Jesus Christ. Every one at times get oppressed through failures, sickness, confusion, frustrations, bitterness etc. You want to be free but can’t seem to find that freedom. Here is how the freedom comes about, Isaiah 10:27, “It shall come to pass in that day that his burden will be taken away from your shoulder, and his yoke from your neck and the yoke will be destroyed because of the anointing“. We have a burden of heaviness laid on us by the enemy to oppress us, the bible says that it has to be taken off the shoulder. The yoke is the next in line cause when you are oppressed, the enemy tries very hard to lead you to his ways and you are fighting to walk in God’s ways. So the yoke has to be taken off. Here is the key, “And the yoke will be destroyed because of the anointing“, if you take off the yoke and put it aside, it’s easy for it to be slipped back. If you break the yoke, there is a possibility that it can put back together but if you destroy it, case closed!!! Look at even documents, if the evidence is destroyed, nothing can be done to bring them back but if you just tear them into pieces, it’s easy to try and put it back together and make some sense out of it. The anointing from above destroys the yoke never to be put back together, “Therefore if the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed” John 8:36..

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: What Must I Do To Be Saved? Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning:

Mathew 19:16-22, Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good ﻿﻿Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?” ﻿17﻿ So He said to him, ﻿﻿“Why do you call Me good? ﻿﻿No one is ﻿good but One, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, ﻿ ﻿keep the commandments.”

It’s an interesting conversation going on between Jesus and the rich young ruler and I love the manner in which Jesus asks questions. He answered him with a question, “Why do you call me good?” I believe Jesus wanted to challenge this man to see far beyond the natural Man, to a supernatural God. He was no ordinary Man and could not be in the same level with this man to be called good. If he called him good, was he refereeing to Jesus as God? Jesus response, “there is none good but God” and Jesus was God therefore He was good.

Now watch what Jesus does with his potential convert, he does not tell him to repeat sinners prayer to be saved, or even tell him about Himself of how He was going to die on the cross for his sins, He goes about to establish was is considered “good” and how to have eternal life. He says, vs. 17, “…but if you will enter into life, keep the commandments”. It’s my humble opinion that Jesus was trying to strip this man of his self righteousness ultimately that he will see his need for a Savior. The first thing He told him, keep the commandments to have eternal life. Upon hearing this, this man would have said, I’m unable to keep the commandments that are summed up in loving the Lord with all your heart and soul, and loving your neighbors as much as you love yourself. But as I mentioned before, he came with his bag of good things if asked, he was ready to produce. Jesus told him to keep the commandments and he asked, which ones. Brilliant Jesus first gave him 5 horizontal commandments, commandments in relation to man, loving his neighbor as much as himself, shall not murder, commit adultery, steal, lie, honor etc. Out of his bag of good things, he said in vs. 20, “…all these things I have kept from my youth up: what lack I yet?”. If this is what it took to have eternal life, he had just passed the test but to keep the commandments, you had to keep all of them. James tells us “Whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend it in one point, he is guilty of all” James 2:10. if you have a new flower vase, it’s perfect. If you drop it and has even a little crack, you’ve shattered it’s perfection. Psalm 19:7, “the law of the Lord is perfect…” To break one commandment is to break them all for you’ve shattered it’s perfection. And those who want to enter heaven by being “good” have to be perfect. And here is something to chew on, if I have six good eggs to make an omelet for my guests and I have one bad egg, one bad egg is enough to ruin the other six.

Jesus sees that this man is determined to have eternal life through the commandments, he has passed the first test so he asks what else, then Vs 21, “Jesus said to him, if you will be perfect, go and sell what you have, and give money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven: and come and follow Me” Here is where the rubber meets the road, He took him to the basis of the first 4 commandments (he had his riches as his god, his riches were his idol, took the name of the Lord in vain (failed to Honor Him as God”), he had no time kept a side to worship God. What he trusted in was not good enough to save him. He had his five good eggs (commandments kept) and four bad eggs (commandments broken). That was enough for him to abandon all he trusted in and look to Jesus to save him.

What are you trusting on to save you on judgment day? the bible says “It’s appointed unto men once to die and after this, but after this judgment” Hebrews 9:27. To finish

title.rendered: What Must I Do To Be Saved? Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,
﻿Mathew 19:16-22, Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good ﻿﻿Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?” ﻿17﻿ So He said to him, ﻿﻿”Why do you call Me good? ﻿﻿No one is ﻿good but One, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, ﻿ ﻿keep the commandments.”

I am a firm believer of going out of my way to speak to the lost about the gospel. There is nothing wrong witnessing with our lifestyle which is important, I just believe we live in a time where people are not searching to know the truth and therefore we have to go out of our way and awaken them to their need of a Savior. For the last 15-16 years I have been a Christian, I have never encountered with anyone who come to me to ask how they can be saved or the hope that is in me. The bible says in John 3:19, “and this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness, rather than light, because their deeds were evil“. This is one of the reasons people are not seeking to be saved, they love darkness and they don’t want the light to expose it so they will not ask.

I will share another reason why people don’t ask shortly. Mathew 19, Mark 10 and Luke 18 tells about a young rich ruler who out of nowhere came to Jesus and asked, “…Good ﻿﻿Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?” ﻿. There is a lot to chew out of this first line. If someone came and asked me how they can receive eternal life, I would really rejoice for I have never had anyone do that. Anyway, we would ask ourselves many questions as to the intentions of this young rich ruler. Mark the things that describe him, he was young, and rich and a ruler. He had everything going for him. What would make a man with his status seek to know what he was to do to have eternal life? Perhaps he wanted to make sure he got it right, or he wanted to see if Jesus really knew what it took to have eternal life or maybe he was really seeking the truth.

Look at his how he addresses Jesus, “Good Teacher…”, his introduction of Jesus already raises a red flag. First, Jesus was more than a good teacher, He was (is) the Messiah, the Savior of the world. He was God in the flesh and no one who has a wrong understanding of who He is can be saved. Today in talking to people, they are ok saying Jesus was a good teacher, a good prophet, a good man and even Son of God. See their faces change when you declare that Jesus Christ was (is) God. Then the rich man asked “…what good thing shall do that I may have eternal life?” This is the second red flag, this man thought you had to do good things to have eternal life, he just was wasn’t sure of what “good” thing he had to do. Romans 3:20﻿ corrects our understanding by saying, “Therefore ﻿﻿by the deeds of the law no flesh will be justified in His sight…“. He had a bag of what he called good, he was ready to go into his bag of what he called good things the moment Jesus would tell him of what they were.

You may be reading this devo and you are not saved or soundly saved and like the rich young ruler, you have a wrong understanding of who Jesus is, or you may be thinking that you have good things to be saved, that it’s just a matter of time before He tells you what these good things are so that you can pull them out of your bag. We’ll find out how Jesus dealt with his potential convert. To continue.

Thanks

title.rendered: Fight The Good Fight

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Timothy 6:12, Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, to which you were also called and have confessed the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.

Christians fight battles every day. If you are not fighting battles, you may need to examine yourself and see if you are in the faith. I’m yet to meet someone who has no battles to fight. Every one will tell us of some types battle they are engaged in. People don’t get engage themselves in battles to be losers, they battle because they want to win. The devil hopes you will through down your weapons and surrender. Who in their right mind would do that?

I have come to realize that our winning strategy in a battle is not necessarily based on how strong we are but how willing we are to fight our way through. In a boxing match, the boxers are tough, trained to fight to win and so is in wrestling but for us believers, we are reminded that the battle is not for the strong neither is the race for the swift but for those who endure.

Fight is to strive vigorously and resolutely or to contend with a struggle against or a confrontation between opposing groups in which they attempt to harm or gain power over. Fight involves force, tactics and skills to over overcome. To continue to live for Christ requires fights everyday and that means fighting temptations, fears, depression etc. In 2Timothy 2:3, says, “You therefore must endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ”. This reminds us that for us to maintain the free gift of eternal life, we must by all means fight to endure all things that try to take it off our hands. As soldiers we go to the battle field to fight and not just fight but fight to win. Fighting to win will require endurance as we push our enemy back. It’s our responsibility to fight for the truth.

1Timothy 6:12, Fight the good fight of faith. We can fight but the question is, are we fighting the good fight? the good fight is fighting that which we know is right in the sight of the Lord. While writing to Timothy, Paul tells him to fight the good fight of faith meaning fight for your salvation, defend it, nurture it cause there will be things that will come around to terminate it. Then he tells him, “lay hold on eternal life”, to remind him to cling on to the gift of eternal life he had received to which he made the declaration in the presence of many witnesses. Paul is advising Timothy all these that in the long run, he may look back at the many battles he endured and rejoice over them. Many terminate their salvation because the fight is fierce but who said it will be an easy journey? Salvation is free, maintaining it requires a fight!!!!

2Timothy 4:7, “I have fought a good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith”. Think about Paul speaking these things but look at the battles in his life, they took away his freedom, they stoned and left him for dead, took away his possessions, his future, churches he ministered in, his life but the only thing they could not take away from him was his faith. He fought a good fight by enduring life obstacles, he finished his race without giving up and fainting on the way. I can’t tell what speed he was doing but the speed did not matter, the fact that he finished the race shows how faithful he was. And most definitely, he kept the faith (salvation).

It’s worth fighting the good fight of faith even when everything around you is falling apart. Everything can be taken away but your faith unless you give it away in other words let go, will remain. It’s not how you start that matters, it’s how you fight, endure and finish. Any one can start a marathon but the question is, who will endure to the finish line? Can you say in the long run, “I fought a good fight, I finished the race, I kept the faith? Fight the good fight till the end. Blessings Evans

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: For Us Or Against Us

content.rendered:
Good morning

Romans 8:31, “What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?

Trust is very fragile if broken, it’s hard to restore. Who does not want to have someone to trust with feelings, secrets etc? The bible says in Psalm 118:8, “It’s better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man”, man can fail, God will never.

Joshua 5:13, “And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, a Man stood opposite him with His sword drawn in His hand. And Joshua went to Him and said to Him, “Are You for us or for our adversaries?“. It’s is very important to know who is on your side and who is not. The reason is simple, he who is on your side believes in you and the ability you have and knows who you are to be able to help you do the right thing. In my text, Joshua was about to go to battle, he sees a Man ready for battle. Just looking at the scripture and how the words have been placed, I am utterly convinced he saw the Lord. Read the verse yourself and you will see these first words in caps Man, You, His, Him. Almighty God is referred to us here. What a comfort to know that the person whom you thought was against you is for you. It’s like I have come because You need me.

Two things to bring to our attention “GOD BE FOR US” AND “GOD BEFORE US”. Romans 8:31, “What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?. I know of many who feel God is against them. It’s disturbing to me because I understand that whoever is against you has an aim to destroy you by all means. I believe that the reason why some people think this way is because they called on God for something but He never came through for them or God allowed something to happen in their lives and to them that was a sign of God being against them. Suppose we asked our earthly father to do something and he did not, does that mean he is against us or does not love us? he is for us, meaning he is on our side looking for our well being. The bible says, “If God be for us” which is interesting because it does not say “When God is for us“. Using “WHEN” would imply that God is not ready yet to be for us for He is in the process of being ready. For sure we know God is always ready. The word “IF” drops the ball in our court because we are the ones who allow God to be for us. Joshua understood this concept because there was a Man (God) who showed up ready but through the question he asked Him showed that the Man was ready to be on someone’s side and that was Joshua’s. So it’s Joshua who needed to allow Him to be for them. We have God on our side always but we have to allow Him to be for us.

GOD BEFORE US, this becomes the tricky one. “God be for us” just means He is on our side but God before us means that not only is He on our side, He is also leading. Joshua 5:14, “So He said, “No, but as a Commander of the army of the Lord I have now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth and worshipped, and said to Him, “What does my Lord say to His servant?” It’s easy to have “God for us” but the most important thing is to have “God before us”. The Man who appeared came in as Commander and we know commanders lead and give orders. And with this understanding not only did Joshua allow Him to be for them, he also allowed Him to go before them. He knew that the man was for them and not against them for He says I have come. Can you trust Him enough “to be for you” and “go before you?” Proverbs 3:5, “Trust in the Lord with all thy heart and lean not on thy own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your paths”

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Eyes like Elisha, by Phil the Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

And Elisha prayed, “O LORD, open his eyes so he may see.” Then the LORD opened the servant’s eyes, and he looked and saw the hills full of horses and chariots of fire all around Elisha. 2 Kings 6:17

Remember driving down the road on a hot day and seeing the illusion of water in the road created by the heat? Many times our eyes are not actually the reality of truth and if we can be fooled physically, how much more can we be fooled in our spiritual eyesight? Read 2 Kings 6:8-18 for the full picture.

The first component to having eyesight like Elisha is to have a reputation of having godly insight. (see v. 11-12) Elisha had a reputation of godly insight among both the godly (King of Israel) & the ungodly (the servant of the Aramean king). How did Elisha gain this reputation? It wasn’t through bragging about his spirituality but through spending time with God as prophets had to do if they were to prophesy God’s word. The only way to obtain a reputation of having godly insight is by spending time with God. Look at how our thoughts (mindset) lead to our destinies:

    “Whoever sows a thought, reaps an action; Whoever sows an action; reaps a habit;

    Whoever sows a habit; reaps a lifestyle; Whoever sows a lifestyle; reaps a destiny.”

If not the prophet was not 100% accurate he would be stoned to death as a false prophet. We cannot cease spending time with God and expect to have a true godly & spiritual reputation.

The second component to having eyesight like Elisha is to not to have fear and unbelief, but trust and faith in the Lord (see v. 14-16) The Armean king sent an army to capture Elisha by a surprise NIGHT ATTACK! However, Elisha received revelation from God, about the attack. You see the eyesight of the ungodly is warped, because they can never see as God sees and shows to His servants. Elisha’s servant is nervous as he sees the city surrounded army of horses and chariots, and therefore asks, “What shall we do?” The situation did not look promising and the young discipleship I can imagine had “I’m gonna die” in his head. Elisha’s responds by saying “Do not fear…,” because Elisha’s could see the fear pent up inside his disciple. Elisha was saying you’re not to respond to the great army outside in fear.

1 Tim 1:7 KJV “For God hath not given us a spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.” Fear is cousins with unbelief, it is the the manifestation of unbelief. Many times because WE magnify our situation or problem it looks bigger then God. Yes the army (problem) was big but the angelic host (God) was bigger!

The third component to having eyesight like Elisha seek the Lord in prayer to gain God’s perspective (v. 16) Elisha saw God’s revelation, but his young disciple didn’t see it Elisha interceded that his disciple might see. His prayer was short, specific, and in faith. Elisha saw the angelic host of horses and chariots of fire that his disciple didn’t see, yet it was certainly there! Through prayer, the young disciple gained Elisha’s perspective on things and turn, God’s perspective. The Lord opened his eyes, and he saw the angelic army surrounding them. He saw what Elisha had said, “…those that are who are with us are more then those who are with them.” As the Scripture says, “If God is for us who can be against us,” therefore “walk by faith and not by sight.”

Application:
But you realize that you don’t have a reputation of spiritual insight because you’ve not been spending time in God’s presence. Or perhaps you have been spending time with the Lord, but fear and unbelief have been shrouding your vision and you desire to trust and have faith in the Lord’s provision and protection to gain God’s perspective. Spend time with the Lord as He is the truth, a refuge, and a mighty warrior.

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings
Phil The Evangelist

title.rendered: Open My Eyes (by Phil the Evangelist)

content.rendered:
Good morning
“Open my eyes so that I may see wonderful things in Your law (Psalm 119:18).”
Isn’t it amazing at a crime scene, that crime scene investigators are able to spot things that the untrained eye would not see. These men and women are trained to look for things that others would not even consider for a moment. It is amazing that two people can look at the exact same thing and see different things. What do you read in the following example: “GODISNOWHERE“? Did you see God is no where? Many people initially see this. However, can you see that it also reads God is now here? Perhaps you just said yourself, “WOW,” I didn’t see both statements. In the same light there can be two people that look into God’s Law, into God’s Word, and not see the same thing. The Psalmist prefaces his statement open my eyes…, with “Deal generously with Your servant, so that I might live; then I will keep Your word.” He desired that God deal liberally, open-handed, with great kindness, so that he might live, because if God is not dealing kindly with him how can he live? As God is dealing kindly and generously with him he will keep God’s Word. He calls himself God’s servant, and a servant does what the Master says. Three times, The Lord called out to Samuel and initially Samuel didn’t realize the voice of the Lord, but when it was told to him by Eli that the voice was God’s voice, he was to respond accordingly to God. Therefore the very next time this took place the Bible says, “﻿Now the Lord came and stood and called as at other times, “Samuel! Samuel!” And Samuel answered, “Speak, for Your servant hears (1 Sam. 3).” The Psalmist in this same humble attitude desired his eyes to be open, so that he might see the wonderful things in God’s law! Everything in God’s law in God’s Word is wonderful. Just think of the word “wonderful“ which means “full-of-wonder.” Proverbs 30:18–19 tells us, “There are three things which are too wonderful for me, Yes, four which I do not understand: 19The way of an eagle in the air, The way of a serpent on a rock, The way of a ship in the midst of the sea, And the way of a man with a virgin. Do you comprehend these things, I think not. One cannot put the love for his or her spouse under a microscope and understand in fullness that complexities of that relationship. God’s Word is certainly full of wonder, but when one is a servant of the Master, then the Master can point out and illuminate His Word to His servant. Why is this? Because the servant (insert your name) can say, “Speak Lord, for your servant is listening…open my eyes that I may see wonderful things in Your law.” The spiritual senses are engaged when receiving what God desires you to hear, to see, to know, to learn, and to do in accordance and obedience to His Word. It is one thing to hear a preacher, to read a Christian book, hear a sermon, read a devotional or article based on God’s Word, but it is an entirely more intimate experience when God shows YOU in His Word apart from someone else’s echoing of God’s Word. I have learned so much through mature Christian brothers and sisters in the Lord as well as through seasoned Christian leaders that chose to stay biblical no matter which was the “theological wind” was blowing at the time. However, I have learned most through spending time with Jesus in prayer, in Bible reading, in journaling thoughts, in memorizing His Word, in meditating on His Word, and in sharing His Word with others. God’s Word is like an archeological dig, there is so much to “unearth” or should I say “unheaven” beneath the pages of God’s Word, or rather within the pages of His Word. Reading through the beginning of Psalm 119, the longest chapter in the Bible, which is predominantly about God’s law, God’s Word, is when God showed me these great nuggets that you are reading today. It all started with this one verse that God seemed to illuminate off the page to me, and before I knew it, this message began to brew in my spirit, and then onto the computer screen. Is God’s Word being illuminated to you? If He is your Master and you are His servant then call out to him in the same attitude of Samuel and the Psalmist, “Speak Lord, for your servant is listening…open my eyes that I may see wonderful things in Your law.”
Seek the Lord today as a servant, when you do, I’m sure you will begin to look into God’s Word and he will illuminate things to you, that were always there, but that you have never seen before. The more I grow in God’s Word, the more this takes place. If I may, I would love to suggest this wonderful resource which will help you on this journey? Click here for the Herman Who? (DVD) resource. Also consider journaling the things that God speaks to you and going back to read the wonderful things he has shown you. Lastly, if appropriate, share those things God opened your eyes to with others and encourage them to do as you have done. Remember God said in Isaiah 55:11, “So shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth; It shall not return to Me ﻿void (empty, fruitless) But it shall accomplish what I please, And it shall ﻿﻿prosper in the thing for which I sent it.“
Until the nets are filled…Blessings Phil The Evangelist

title.rendered: Let The Truth Be Known, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,
1Timothy 4:12, “Let no man despise your youth, but be an example to the believers in word, in conduct, in love, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
I read this book about relationships entitled, “Too close too soon”, it’s a great book for those who are building godly relationships. It’s about avoiding the heartache of premature intimacy. How we desire godly relationships that can last so that we can be an example to others. I have come to realize that many don’t progress because of what they saw in their families. For example, a man may believe that if his father cheated on his mother, most likely he might repeat the same in their own life. I refuse that mentality in Jesus name, a Godly relationship is not based on someone else life style, it’s based on the lifestyle Jesus talks about in His word. You cannot change the past but sure you can affect and change the future with God on your side and with you making intelligent and godly decisions.
It is said that you can not teach someone how to fall in love but you can show them how to survive falling in love. A relationship is an intimate connection between two people-the more intimate the interaction, the more significant the relationship. But what constitutes to keeping relationship working out? Today people don’t want to invest in their relationships to make it work out because of the canned version of it seen out there but let the truth has to be known and that is, it’s a hard work, very scary and only those who value it will invest in it.
The first things I believe is understanding how both men and women look and respond to things. “Alike and Different between men and women”. I believe that knowing our differences will help us know and understand each other.
Most Men … Most Women …
Are providers for the home are Protectors of the home
Are Initiators are Responders
Conquers by force or wit Conquers with love
Are Objective are Subjective
are thing centered are people oriented
are Logical are Intuitive
are Impersonal are Personal
are Steady (inflexible) are Adaptable
Communication is straight to the point Communication is sensitive to the other person’s responses
Looks for essentials Look for the aesthetic
are future-minded (has long range goals) are present, minded (sets short-range goals)
Needs significance in life Needs security
Tendency to egotism Tendency to jealousy
Soul-modest and body-free Body-modest and soul-free
Desires sex Dreams of love
Are Passionate are Romantic
Neglects tasks Nags partner (Often about neglecting tasks
Defeated by discouragement Defeated by loneliness
I asked myself, why do people abandon relationships and this is what I came up with. Unrealistic expectations, diminishing excitements, excessive conflicts, poor relational skills and lack of understanding between partners. Just looking at these, this can happen to a relationships where both partners are believers, but how will it happen if one is not a believer? I wish I had time I would have gone into depth about the reasons why people abandon relationships.
Being an example is tough but you know that when you have made it, you have people who look up to you and pray that God would give them what He has given you. Already getting involved with unbeliever is out of question unless you want to be outside God’s will. Desire what is good, pray to God for the best, wait patiently for His timing, when He blesses you, take time to learn, build, invest and make it work for there are people who are out there watching you. Desire to be an example!!!!
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Let The Truth Be Known, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Psalm 37:7, “Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for Him; Do not fret…”
People talk about different dreams and desires. The ones I hear the most are to finish school, build a career, get married, settle down, have kids. I have talked to many teenagers and when I ask them of their dreams, you will hear things like be relationship one day and get married. They are God given desires in our lives. It’s not us who see, it’s the Lord who sees, puts the desire and works with us to accomplish it. James 1:17, “Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow of turning”. God is the author of good things including good relationships and no one wants a bad relationship because God has not put a desire for bad things in our lives. How is it then that many find themselves in bad relationships?.
We like to have a point of reference, something or someone to give us ideas of what something is like. How can you pick out and be in a good relationship if you never saw one acted out?. Maybe while growing up, your father left and so there was no male figure in the house to really teach you through his life style what a good husband would be. Some fathers were so dysfunctional that they left their children with no clue on how to pick the best or what a good relationship is like. Novels and movies have tried to paint a good picture full of fantasies and only showed one side of the coin. Who then do we look to teach us all we need to know? Thank God He has given us a book full of answers.
According to a survey done on Christian women, these are the qualities a Christian woman desired of a man. 1. Committed to putting Christ first in his life, grounded in the Word, a spiritual leader, church attendance and service would be vital part of his life. 2. Able to lead, making good decisions and responsible. 3. Affectionate and loving in that he will both talk of and show his love. 4. In control of himself in the area of temper, physical violence, sexual, financial. 5. Masculine, a man who God has created him to be. 6. Attractive 7. Tender and considerate. Sensitive to the feeling of others and being unafraid to reach out and be open up in the area of communication. This one happened to be some of the most important things women expressed as their desires. Are not all these qualities addressed in the bible?
As for the men, they desired 1. A woman committed to putting Christ first in her life. Her personal relationship with God would be strong and close. She would be actively involved in the church. 2. Submissive which is voluntary cooperation with the man’s leadership. 3. Responsive, loving and affectionate. Women to respond to their husband’s love as wives. 4. Supportive in making decisions, when succeeding or when failing miserably. Criticizing, nagging, complaining, and belittling were given as easy ways to destroy a relationship. 5. Feminine, a woman who God created her to be, Proverbs 31 woman. 6. Gentle in spirit, not physically violent, harboring hatred, bitterness, resentments or jealousy’s. Guys talked about women who are in control of their emotional lives and honest enough about negative emotions to confront their partners lovingly. 7. Attractive.
Have you read the word to know what is acceptable and prayed God’s will along those lines? If you look at the list for both men and women, there are certain qualities that differ but the one that remains the same, GOD FIRST (the foundation), His word, fellowship, church, prayers. As I mentioned earlier, God has given each of us a desire, a dream and choices. Proverbs 16:1, tells us “The preparation of heart belong to man, But the answer of the tongue is from God”. The people who participated in the survey had their preparation they brought out but the final word has to be from the Lord. Why is it that people can desire these qualities and settle for something else? You have to do your part by praying and then let God to His part of approving. When you know what you desire and you have prayed, Psalm 37:7, “Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for Him; Do not fret…” Resting in the Lord mean calmed down knowing that the Maker does not slumber and does not make any mistakes. Waiting patiently is knowing that as He is working on your companion while working on you too. After it has been said and done, you will still need rest and patience to maintain a relationship. We have to communicate the truth to people otherwise we will be stuck with the version of the Hollywood mushroom relationships that have no foundation built on God and God given character. Be true to yourself, know what is right and what is acceptable. To continue
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Let The Truth Be Known, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,
2Corinthians 6:14, “Do not be unequally yoked together with the unbelievers. For what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness? And what communion has light with darkness”
“The promises of God are ye and amen“, the bible tells me. I find it difficult to patiently wait for a promise. I would rather not know about it and be surprised. To share along the lines of what I shared yesterday, let me talk about dating especially for Christians. For those who are married, this may not be relevant to you directly but you can use it to share truth with some of your single friends.
The challenge many face is to patiently wait for God’s direction. When you’ve prayed for companion, asked according to God’s will in line with His word, it’s hard to wait to see Him intervene. As time goes by, you feel like your patience is running out because God has not moved within the time you expected. Then you become attracted to unsaved person, pursue a relationship with them hoping God will save them and bless your relationship. I hear more of the saved dating or are in relationship with the unsaved and that amazes me for I am utterly convinced by the word of God that it’s not right. Introduction and foundation in anything is vital for a good thing to take place or even survive.
Any guidelines the Lord gives us is not to stop us from enjoying ourselves but to stop us from making the wrong choices and decisions that will haunt us in a long time. They say, “forbidden fruit looks delicious and attractive but inside of it is poison ready to kill“. Look at what happened to Samson and you will understand what I am saying.
The bible is very precise when it talks about dealing with the unbelievers, Psalm 1:1, “Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly“, if you want to be blessed, do not go by the wisdom of the unsaved, don’t be involved with them and by this I do not mean that you can not hang out with them. What I am saying, it’s not good to try and pursue a relationship with them. Why say so, what is right before God may not be right in the eyes of the unbelievers. Some unbelievers do not see anything wrong with lust, fornication, lying, putting God first, covet, in other words, breaking God’s laws is very normal to them but for the believers who know the truth, seek to please God. To be in relationship with someone who is in God’s will is the best way to go.
2Corinthians 6:14, “Do not be unequally yoked together with the unbelievers. For what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness? And what communion has light with darkness”. To make this verse simpler, the word “Do not” is not a suggestion but a warning. “unequally yoked” is to be bound together. When you talk about a yoke, it’s a crossbar with two U-shaped pieces that encircles the neck of a pair of oxen or other draft animals working together. The yoke is bound to set two to work together either for good or for evil. Trying to yoke unbeliever with a believer would mean war to work together but towards what? Statistics show that the evil can easily corrupt and damage the good. “For what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness?”, here we go again, the believer knows what is right and wants to live by them, the unbeliever calls what is wrong right, Proverbs 16:2, “All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,…“, Jeremiah 17:9, “The heart is deceitful above all things and desperately wicked, who can know it“. “And what communion has light with darkness“, Light and darkness are great enemies because light will expose darkness. John 3:19, “And this is the condemnation, that the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil, vs. 20, “for everyone practicing evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed“. If you are a believer and you hook up with unbeliever, they may not want to come the light. Why should they when they’ve got what they were looking for? it’s a trap, the enemy is setting you up.
To conclude for today, His word is for our own good and safety and if we live by it, we can expect to be blessed and we will set ourselves ready to receive the promise cause the bible says, “Faithful is He that has promised”. With this truth choose wisely!!!, Blessings Evans.
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: And God Saw…

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Genesis 2:18-25, “And the Lord said, “it is not good that man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him”
Our God is a creative, imaginative, thinking God. There is nothing He created that did not have a meaning and a purpose. From the book of Genesis, every stage of creation He completed He concluded it was good. I have seen some un attractive creatures but He created and call them good.
Allow me to share a message with the singles. I am not an expert on this but I believe that with the truth from the text and what I have learnt will help shade some light to the singles. You may not agree totally with me on everything.
Lets try and understand how God created male and female, looking at Genesis 1:27, “So God created man in His own image; in the image of God He created him; male and female He created them”. Ok, now lets jump to Genesis 2:5-7, “… and there was no man to till the ground; but a mist went up from the earth and watered the whole face of the ground, and the Lord formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul”. Sounds a little confusing because if God created male and female in Genesis 1, why should we see the making of man in Genesis 2 and this time it does not talk about the female?. You’ve heard me address this before, God created the Spirit of both male and female, then He reached to the ground and formed the body of man to which He put His spirit and when He breathed in it, man became a living soul. We still do not see the picture of the woman being presented to us.
In the next few verses we see the Lord working with man in the garden of Eden and giving him instructions on how to lead, what to watch for and what not to do. Finally in verse 18, “And the Lord said, “it is not good that man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him”. What amazes me about this line is that it was God’s idea, man who is now Adam had no clue that he needed a helpmeet, it’s God who saw. I believe that God sees whether singles need to be involved or not and if involved, at what stage of life. I don’t think it’s our duty to see and dwell on it so much because it’s not us who decides but the Lord. Adam was minding God’s business when God decided to bless him with a helpmeet. Be content with your single hood, take care of God’s business faithfully while you are still single, and in due time God will see that it’s not good for you to be alone. Let God be the one to stand and fight for you, Psalm 46:10, “Be still and know that I am God”.
There is no one who thinks a head like God and there is no one who accomplishes things like God. God never moves in the way that we would imagine or think, when you expect Him to come through the door, He shows up through the window. This causes me to understand that when I let it go, I don’t have to worry about how He will do it but just know He will. In the story God formed all the creatures out of the ground and so was Adam. Vs. 21, “And the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall on Adam, and he slept”, if you desire someone, stop fighting it and trying to make it on your own, go to sleep and rest, let the Master do what He knows how to do best. Vs. 21, “and He took one of ribs, and closed up the flesh in it’s place”. Men can I talk to us for a sec, while we were busy trying to look around to see what was out there, we failed to understand that she was already in us, all we needed to do at the right time was to go to sleep and have God pull out that precious rib. God is not going to reach to the ground again and make someone for you, she is already in you. Ladies, let God form you and shape you and bring you to the Adam He has saved for you. Remember that God pulled out the rib worked on it to make Eve and in the morning brought her to Adam who she did not know about. In the morning Adam wakes up and sees someone he can relate to and immediately he knows, in vs. 23, “that she is the bone of his bones, and the flesh of his flesh” I know the married can testify to this for the moment God brought them together, the now husband knew for sure that she was the bone of his bones and the flesh of his flesh without him being told. He is so much pleased with the handy work of God that he come with a name WO-MAN.
Men, she is already in you so go to sleep and relax and women, you are the missing rib He is working on and being perfected that He may bring you to your right Adam. I have more but that might take more pages!!!
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: God’s Decrease, Your Increase (Sifting for Victory) 3, Expanded from Way of the Master Minute By Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,
16﻿ Then he divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put a trumpet into every man’s hand, with empty pitchers, and torches inside the pitchers. ﻿17﻿ And he said to them, “Look at me and do likewise; watch, and when I come to the edge of the camp you shall do as I do: ﻿18﻿ When I blow the trumpet, I and all who are with me, then you also blow the trumpets on every side of the whole camp, and say, ‘The sword of the Lord and of Gideon!’ ” Judges 7:16 – 18)
When Gideon was told by God to form an army, He cut it down in size. The fearful were told to go home. Those who didn’t look out for the enemy while drinking water were dismissed. The rest were instructed to break vessels (pitchers) in the darkness, so that their lights would shine. The Apostle Paul writes, “﻿7﻿But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, ﻿that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us (2 Cor. 4:7).” The excellence of Gideon’s army was certainly not in there numeric amount of men. We are those earthen vessels, with the power of the Gospel in our lives. The Gospel is not simply a creed that one can recite, but “it is the power of God unto salvation,” which is why Paul also says we are not to be ashamed of it (Roman 1:16). Gideon put light inside the broken vessels, and when God broke the hardness of hearts with the conviction from His divine Law, he healed that broken heart by placing the Light of the Gospel within our lives. Who is the light of the Gospel? Jesus said of Himself, ﻿“I am the light of the world. He who ﻿follows Me shall not walk in darkness, but have the light of life (John 8:12)
If He is in your life, then His light is in you for a purpose. Matthew records Jesus saying to followers of Christ, “You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden. ﻿15﻿ Nor do they ﻿light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.﻿16﻿ Let your light so shine before men, ﻿that they may see your good works and ﻿﻿glorify your Father in heaven (Matthew 5:14 – 16). Christians are the body of Christ and He is the head of the Body.
Gideon’s army was to lift up their voices in a shout. Have you enlisted into the Army of God, and yet are more concerned about your fears than you are about the fate of the lost? Then stay at home and pray. Do you believe that you are in a spiritual battle against unseen demonic powers? If not, then you had better stay home.. The Sword of the Lord (God’s Word) is still “living and powerful, and ﻿﻿sharper than any ﻿﻿two-edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of joints and marrow, and is ﻿﻿a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart. It is our offensive weapon (Eph 6). If you believe in the cause of the Gospel, then be a broken vessel and let your light shine. Jesus’ chose a small group of twelve to reach the world, showing He doesn’t need great numbers, because He can do much with little. The Laborers are still few, so lift up your voice as a trumpet and use the Sword of the Spirit to show this people their transgressions as you do battle against darkness for the salvation of those Christ died to save.
Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Phil The Evangelist <><

title.rendered: God’s Decrease, Your Increase (Sifting for Victory), part 2, By Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,
“During that night the LORD said to Gideon, “Get up, go down against the camp, because I am going to give it into your hands. If you are afraid to attack, go down to the camp with your servant Purah and listen to what they are saying. Afterward, you will be encouraged to attack the camp.” So he and Purah his servant went down to the outposts of the camp. (Judges 7: 9 – 11)
Gideon’s army was less then 1 percent of its original size after the shifting took place, when God cut the majority of troops from the team through the leadership of Gideon. Gideon is resting at night, and God interrupts his rest with urgent orders to respond to divinely urgent news. Gideon is commanded to get up because God is going to give him the victory if he would attack immediately. Knowing Gideon’s heart, God sees Gideon’s fear, and responds to it with encouragement. Although faith is the opposite of fear at times we need to be navigated from one point to the other on the vehicle of encouragement. God told Gideon if you are too afraid to attack right now then spy on your enemies and eavesdrop on their conversation, you will be encouraged by what you hear. What could they possible hear from the enemy that would give them encouragement?
In sports competition I would love it if the opposing team would begin to fight against themselves, or when they would somehow lose heart. A divided team can’t stand, and a team that has no heart because it is gripped by fear has crippled themselves before engaging in the battle. At this point both armies were fearful of one another, but God was about to rip the fear from Gideon’s heart and encourage him, thus replacing fear with faith. Gideon and Purah (most likely his armor-bearer) eavesdrop on the enemies camp and, “Gideon arrived just as a man was telling a friend his dream. “I had a dream,” he was saying. “A round loaf of barley bread came tumbling into the Midianite camp. It struck the tent with such force that the tent overturned and collapsed.” His friend responded, “This can be nothing other than the sword of Gideon son of Joash, the Israelite. God has given the Midianites and the whole camp into his hands.” No doubt this dream came from God to their enemies, as the fear of Gideon’s sword ransacked their minds, gripping them with fear, discouragement, and defeat, before the battle was even engaged. I believe it was at this point that Gideon finally believed God. There are some great truth here for God’s present day soldiers, you and me.
  1. God’s Word is timely. We are bound by the realm of time, and God is not. God told Gideon to go now to either battle or eavesdrop and Gideon obeyed. Our enemies are defeated already, but we need to listen to God’s Word to be reminded of that truth. Jesus said in John 8:31 – 32, “If you…continue in my word…the truth will set you free.” God’s Word brings freedom if we apply it. Are you a hearer of God’s Word or a doer of God’s Word?
2. God’s Word is encouraging. We’ve all been discouraged. Gideon’s army was decreased yet the battle was still on the horizon. Both armies were gripped with fear, but God cares for his people, and meets our discouragement with encouragement, fighting fear with faith. Are you discouraged today, I’ve been there many times, go to God’s Word but you need not go alone.
3. God’s Word brings partnership. Gideon was commanded to go with Purah, his confidant, his close trustworthy partner. I can picture them smiling with huge grins at each other and being able to encourage one another. Now there were two people bringing encouragement back to the camp together. We need a close partner, who is yours? Do you encourage each other?
Battles are here, more are coming, but God’s Word is timely, encouraging, and brings partnership. God is victorious, let us act by faith upon his Word by being obedient to Him, regardless of the fear that grips our hearts. Go to God’s Word and allow it to silence the fear that grips you.
Until the nets are filled…
Blessings,
Pastor Phil <

title.rendered: God’s Decrease, Your Increase (Sifting for Victory), By Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“The LORD said to Gideon, “You have too many men for me to deliver Midian into their hands. In order that Israel may not boast against me that her own strength has saved her,” (Judges 7:2)

When you are facing a difficult battle ahead does it make sense to decrease your weapons? Gideon was the leader of Israel’s army, and God would decrease the size of Gideon’s army with a battle just on the horizon. The Lord’s instructions probably came as a complete shock to Gideon. I can imagine the he was confused upon hearing, “You have too many men for me to deliver Midian into their hands.” That doesn’t sound very sensible to me; decrease your army size, because there are too many men for battle. Gideon’s army was already outnumbered four to one. When I was trying out for sports teams growing up, if one didn’t qualify for the team they were cut from the team, so that only the best players were left to produce a winning team. There were usually two cuts that took place. This is what God did when he sifted Gideon’s army. God cut the first wave of people from the team by having Gideon announce, “Anyone who trembles with fear may turn back and leave Mount Gilead.” The result was that “twenty-two thousand men left, while ten thousand remained.” The first cut allowed the cowards to disqualify themselves and go back home to mommy. Now God would have second cuts, and reduce Gideon’s army even further. A special examination or screening was set up based on the manner of water drinking among the 10,000 remaining soldiers. There the LORD told him, “Separate those who lap the water with their tongues like a dog from those who kneel down to drink.” (7:4) Three hundred men lapped with their hands to their mouths. All the rest got down on their knees to drink.” Those that kneeled down to drink were cut, and those that apparently crouched down to scoop up water by using their hands as a dog uses its tongue remained. The LORD said to Gideon, “With the three hundred men that lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hands.” The size of the army went from 32,000 to 10,000 to a mere 300 men to fight. Why would God do such a thing?

    1. God can do a lot with a little. God can bring a victory with a few as easily as he could with a large army. Israel would not be able to boast about their victory, as the Lord removed all ground for boasting. Sometimes God reduces you in order to prepare you to move forward, and increase you. John the Baptist said, “He must Increase, I must decrease (John 3:30).” But this is not all.

    2. God decreases us to show Himself strong. God said, “…for my power is made perfect in weakness.” [Paul replied] Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ’s power may rest on me.” The world needs to see God’s power through your weakness. Are you shinning brightly, or dimly?

    3. God Knows those that are willing to take risks for Him. Not everyone is willing to obey God when things seem illogical on the surface. Sifting Gideon’s army for battle is not good military strategy in the natural, but in the supernatural it was just what the Master ordered, and Gideon obeyed. What would you have done?

God can do a lot with very little to show Himself strong, and He knows those that are willing to take risks for Him even when “reason” says otherwise. I, you, we serve a victorious God. What is He asking you to do without to accomplish His will? Are you willing to take that risk?

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><
