title.rendered: Don’t Let Go Off My Hand, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Mathew 14:22, “And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him…”
Before I deal with “BUT” in reference to where we left, let me draw a verse to communicate something important, Mathew 14:28, And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if its You, command me to come to You on the water”, vs. 29 “So He said, “come” and when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus”. There is something about this scripture that strikes me and that is, YOU GOT TO WANT SOMETHING TO GO FOR IT without it being forced on you. Peter saw Jesus walking on water and desired the same. Maybe by that time Jesus had already spoken these words in John 14:12, “”Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes in Me, the works that I do, he will do also; and greater works than these he will do; because I go to the Father”. It’s Peter who desired to operate by faith while the rest of the disciples sat in the boat frightened. Now remember Peter was weak in many areas if you read his story but that did not stop him from believing Jesus in attempting the impossible. With his desire and faith mixed with Jesus word, he was able to do the impossible, Mark 9:23″…all things are possible to him that believeth“. Now let’s look at the “BUT” in beginning to walk on water.
Mathew 14:30, “BUT when he saw the wind was boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink…”. This is where many people’s faith’s are challenged while walking on water like Peter. All of a sudden, they look around and get overwhelmed by the winds of life. The ship is behind them which represents where they came from, the Lord is before them who said come and because of the overwhelming situations, their focus on the Lord changes and they begin to focus on the circumstance. See walking with and towards the Lord is not easy for you got to want to. As long as Peter’s eyes were fixed on Jesus, regardless of what was around him none of that could have an effect on him but the moment he withdrew his eyes from the one who commanded him to come, doubt came in, fear, anxiety, hopelessness and that is what caused him to begin to sink. He did not just sink at once but he began to. The moment you stop reading His word in search of the truth, and you stop praying, you even stop mixing with the other believers, being in a church where you can be fed, believe me, you will begin to sink. I ask myself many questions everyday about the Lord and let me not give you an impression that I have it all together, I am struggling myself with issues but I am trying my best with God’s grace to keep my eyes focused on Him. If I give up on the Lord, where can I go?, whom can I turn to?, where will my help come from?, I can’t even hide from His presence?. In short without God in my life, I am handicapped, paralyzed, blind and dead. He is everything to me and so my prayer everyday is Lord help me keep my eyes focused on You for I do not want to sink in what other people are sinking in. This is my desire, this is my passion and I want it and I am going for it.
Matthew 14:30″.. and beginning to sink he cried out saying, “Lord, save me!”. Peter was a fisherman and as a fisherman, he must have known how to swim, a man of skills. On this particular day, everything he knew about could no help him, the friends whom he left in the boat could not help him the only one who could help and save him is the same one he stopped looking to. We can have all the expertise in dealing with life, but there will come a time when all you know and have will not save you, only Jesus.
Mathew 14:31, “And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him”, Jesus is amazing for when Peter cried out, immediately Jesus came to his rescue but wait a minute, Jesus could have stopped the wind, He could have also commanded the water not allow him to sink, he could have also called a boat or ship into existence and He could have frozen the water but He did not. Are you waiting for the Lord to change the surrounding for you to fit in as you maintain your salvation? Jesus had to change Peter for him to fit in a surrounding that was wild. And the first thing He did was stretch His hand and catch him. I bet Peter had his hands raised out for Jesus to pick him up. As long as Peter was holding on to the hand of the Master, he could not drown and if he would have thought of letting go of His hand that could have marked his end. At the time of rescue, Jesus did not change the situation but His hand was enough to keep Peter from sinking. I am glad to know that even if He did not change the situation and surrounding, He is holding my hand. I would have sank without His hand.
Friends if you are sinking, take a look closely and you will see the hand of the Master is stretched out to save you from sinking but you have to want it and that would mean doing your part, crying out to Him, stretching forth your hand and setting your eyes back on Him. And for those who have their hand on Jesus hand, His word for you and I is, “DON’T LET GO OFF MY HAND”. You may and will not understand many things but don’t let go off His hands, to be honest with you, He is all you got. Get yourself back to reading His word, let Him show you who He is, don’t stop praying, please do spiritual evaluation and see where you are, don’t stop going to church. DON’T LOOSE FOCUS

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Don’t Let Go Off My Hand, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 14:22, “And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him…”

I have concern for some people I know and some my friends walking away from their faith because things are going on in their lives as they expect. The book that was once precious and had all the details pertaining life has been put a side simply because someone stopped believing some or everything written in it. Many criticize the bible because the bible stands firm on truth without a blink. Many have ended up saying that the bible does not make sense. God is too BIG and my mind is too small to contain what He has to say. Even if He made sense, I would not even understand or even comprehend it. One prophet in the bible tried to understand who God is and all He concluded was that His Wisdom cannot be fathomed, His ways are great and marvelous. And as I have been looking at some of my friends who are giving up on God, the Lord reminded me that there could be someone too in this team on the verge of drifting back.

Let me shade some truth from the word of God to myself and to someone who really needs the word this morning. You got to want it to have it and if you are not hungry, this word might not be of any help to you. This is not a word to inspire you, it’s a life transforming word. I know that we all love to be inspired and I love to do so, but I pray that these devotions will not just inspire you only for a day, but strengthen, develop, build, transform you that you may be a man or a woman of God.

In my text this morning, a text that I have covered before we see Jesus not present with the disciples as usual and it’s because He asked them to board the ship while He went to send home the people who had come to listen to him speak. He had taught them, healed them and even fed them and it was time they parted company. There after He went to pray and when He was done He came down to meet His disciples. Meanwhile the disciples, who most of them were professional fishermen were faced by fierce wind that tossed the ship back and forth. Like the disciples, do you realize that we are in the sea of life being tossed around by waves everyday. In the process, some people’s ships have been torn into pieces by the fierce winds of life and they drowned. The disciples were afraid of the events taking place, they didn’t have the miracle worker with them in the ship and that is a good thing because number one God wants to bring us from a place of just operating on miracles to operating on blessings for miracles are seasonal while blessings talks of abundance, Blessings endure but that is not my message this morning.

Mathew 14:26, “And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It’s a ghost!” and they cried out for fear”. Here are a people who had seen the Master do great and mighty things but there was something that they had never seen Him do and that is walk on water. Their first impression was that He was a ghost and this reminds me of the first time I came to know the Lord, as long as I was seeing Him with my eyes, I was seeing a different being but the moment He began to speak to me and reveal Himself, I began to see Him as He is and my life began to change and all the fears and doubts I had began to diminish for He was doing the impossible in my life. The bible says that “whatever is impossible with man is possible with God“.

Mathew 14:28, And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if its You, command me to come to You on the water”, vs. 29 “So He said, “come” and when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus”. With Peter seeing Jesus as He was (is), a desire came in his heart to meet His Master and said Lord if it’s You, command me to come to You. The first time when I received Christ, many things did not make sense to me and I said the same, Lord if it’s You, save me, cleanse me, purify me and change me and just like Jesus told Peter, COME, I came with my limited knowledge of who He was (is). I am amazed that the Lord did not take time to make sense out of the situation, He did not even give Peter instructions, plans, what to watch for and what to keep in mind. His simple told him “come”. Here comes the part where I see many get excited about, Peter began to walk on water and I see the same when people get saved, they walk on water, they are excited about the change, they can’t stop talking about God and their desire is to live for Christ, everyone knows about their stand BUT…

I got to stop here today, I will deal with the BUT on Monday.. The question I leave with you today, ARE YOU DRIFTING BACK?

Thanks
Evans

I am amazed that the Lord did not take time to make sense out of the situation, He did not even give Peter instructions, plans, what to watch for and what to keep in mind. His simple told him “come”. Here comes the part where I see many get excited about, Peter began to walk on water and I see the same when people get saved, they walk on water, they are excited about the change, they can’t stop talking about God and their desire is to live for Christ, everyone knows about their stand BUT…

I got to stop here today, I will deal with the BUT on Monday.. The question I leave with you today, ARE YOU DRIFTING BACK?

Thanks

title.rendered: Don’t Let Go Off My Hand, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 14:22, “And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him…”

I have concern for some people I know and some my friends walking away from their faith because things are going on in their lives as they expect. The book that was once precious and had all the details pertaining life has been put a side simply because someone stopped believing some or everything written in it. Many criticize the bible because the bible stands firm on truth without a blink. Many have ended up saying that the bible does not make sense. God is too BIG and my mind is too small to contain what He has to say. Even if He made sense, I would not even understand or even comprehend it. One prophet in the bible tried to understand who God is and all He concluded was that His Wisdom cannot be fathomed, His ways are great and marvelous. And as I have been looking at some of my friends who are giving up on God, the Lord reminded me that there could be someone too in this team on the verge of drifting back.

Let me shade some truth from the word of God to myself and to someone who really needs the word this morning. You got to want it to have it and if you are not hungry, this word might not be of any help to you. This is not a word to inspire you, it’s a life transforming word. I know that we all love to be inspired and I love to do so, but I pray that these devotions will not just inspire you only for a day, but strengthen, develop, build, transform you that you may be a man or a woman of God.

In my text this morning, a text that I have covered before we see Jesus not present with the disciples as usual and it’s because He asked them to board the ship while He went to send home the people who had come to listen to him speak. He had taught them, healed them and even fed them and it was time they parted company. There after He went to pray and when He was done He came down to meet His disciples. Meanwhile the disciples, who most of them were professional fishermen were faced by fierce wind that tossed the ship back and forth. Like the disciples, do you realize that we are in the sea of life being tossed around by waves everyday. In the process, some people’s ships have been torn into pieces by the fierce winds of life and they drowned. The disciples were afraid of the events taking place, they didn’t have the miracle worker with them in the ship and that is a good thing because number one God wants to bring us from a place of just operating on miracles to operating on blessings for miracles are seasonal while blessings talks of abundance, Blessings endure but that is not my message this morning.

Mathew 14:26, “And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It’s a ghost!” and they cried out for fear”. Here are a people who had seen the Master do great and mighty things but there was something that they had never seen Him do and that is walk on water. Their first impression was that He was a ghost and this reminds me of the first time I came to know the Lord, as long as I was seeing Him with my eyes, I was seeing a different being but the moment He began to speak to me and reveal Himself, I began to see Him as He is and my life began to change and all the fears and doubts I had began to diminish for He was doing the impossible in my life. The bible says that “whatever is impossible with man is possible with God“.

Mathew 14:28, And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if its You, command me to come to You on the water”, vs. 29 “So He said, “come” and when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus”. With Peter seeing Jesus as He was (is), a desire came in his heart to meet His Master and said Lord if it’s You, command me to come to You. The first time when I received Christ, many things did not make sense to me and I said the same, Lord if it’s You, save me, cleanse me, purify me and change me and just like Jesus told Peter, COME, I came with my limited knowledge of who He was (is). I am amazed that the Lord did not take time to make sense out of the situation, He did not even give Peter instructions, plans, what to watch for and what to keep in mind. His simple told him “come”. Here comes the part where I see many get excited about, Peter began to walk on water and I see the same when people get saved, they walk on water, they are excited about the change, they can’t stop talking about God and their desire is to live for Christ, everyone knows about their stand BUT…

I got to stop here today, I will deal with the BUT on Monday.. The question I leave with you today, ARE YOU DRIFTING BACK?

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Name Above Every Name

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Philippians 2:9, “Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him the name which is above every name, 10 that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth, 11 and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father”

It’s been known that the name Mohammed (also spelled in different ways) is the most given name than any other name in the world. I used to think it was John!!. I think the name Jesus is the most HATED name in America if not in the world. Think about it, which name is frequently used as a curse word or used to express disgust?, Jesus and times His title Christ added to it. Which name would people most likely eliminate from anything? Once again, Jesus. There are many who are offended by this name and then there are those people who accommodate it, then there are people who pretend to love this name and then there are us, Christians who love the name Jesus. We don’t love the name because it sounds good, we love it because of who He is and the power in His name. It’s not just a name as we will see in the scriptures.

Last night came across “American Idol give back” whatever the name of last night show was. On this show, they were raising money to support poor children in Africa and other parts of the world. The contestants stood up to sing “Shout to the Lord” and I was like, wow, they are going to sing about Jesus on national TV with over 30million people watching. Then the beginning of the song that says “My JESUS, My SAVIOR, LORD there is NONE like you” was eliminated completely and it began by “my shepherd, my comfort“. The name “Jesus” is in the song, in fact, the song is about Him and for Him. He is the whole reason for the song yet they left His name out.

Oh I love His name, it sounds sweet on my lips, Proverbs 18:10, “the name of the Lord is a strong tower; the righteous run to it and they are safe”, 2 Samuel 22:4, “I will call upon the (name of the) LORD, who is worthy to be praised; So shall I be saved from my enemies. Acts 4:12, “Nor is there salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”. I remember about 10 years ago, on a snowy night, I was coming from school and down the hill my car lost control, getting off the road and heading towards the trees by the road side. The name I could think about and the name that could save me I shouted out was the name highly exalted, the name above every name, the name JESUS. The car missed two trees head on and landed in between them with no scratch and no injuries. Calling on that name saved me that day. And how many times have I called on that name and I believe you too have done the same? Oh I don’t take that name casually or use it loosely, I pray in that name. People get saved through that name. We get healed through that name. Demons tremble at the mention of that name. There is something about that name.

God the Father gave His faithful Son who was obedient even unto the death of the cross by first exalting Him which means He highly elevated His rank and then gave Him “the” not “a” name above EVERY name, 10 that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth, 11 and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father”. God the Father did not take the name of His Son Jesus lightly neither can I. “No other name but the name of Jesus, No other name but the name of the Lord, He is worthy of GLORY and worthy of HONOR and worthy of POWER and of PRAISE”. Oh that people who fear the name of the Lord, cherish His name, Reverence His name.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Growing In Holiness

content.rendered:
Good morning

Galatians 5:16, “This I say then, walk in the Spirit and ye shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh”

In the Old Testament time, people were given laws to live by. Your living depended on whether you followed them or not. If one broke a law whose penalty was death, not only was he killed, his entire household was wiped out. Why would God kill an entire family if only one person sinned? simple, if one sinned, the sin would linger in the family unto the generations to come and so what one member of the family did, it was bound to happen again through another generation within the family. David had lust problem, we see the same with Solomon and Abhner. These were the David’s sons, you might say that’s a coincident, wait a minute, Abraham lied about his wife being his sister, not too long after, Isaac (Abraham’s son) comes a long and does the same about his wife being his sister then we see Jacob (Isaac’s son) lying to his father and receives a blessing meant for his brother Esau. You can see pattern the reason why God would wipe out an entire family to start a new seed. If God was to deal with us the way He dealt with the people in those times, we would all be dead. We thank God for Jesus.

We are called to purity, something I always fear to talk about when I struggle with it myself. If you look in the bible there is not a word repeated three times in the same line like the word Holy. You see holy, holy, holy is the Lord repeated in the bible. This to me reminds me that there is much to know about who God is especially in the area of holiness. We don’t hear love, love, love or mercy, mercy, mercy. We serve a holy God to which the 24 elders in the book of Revelation bowed and cried holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty, who was who is and is to come..

If we walk in the spirit, we allow ourselves not to be in the flesh for the flesh craves for the things of the world while the Spirit craves for the things of the Father. To be holy is not about perfection for us but direction (growing in holiness), we still live in a fallen world. Many walk in the flesh, do things in the flesh and try to please God in the flesh but I would pray this morning that we will put aside the sins of the flesh that easily besets and begin to walk in the Spirit. The Spirit like the fire alarm will convict you of the things. The choice is whether to listen or yank the battery off the fire alarm.

The bible says “Be ye holy for I am holy”, it’s tough to stay holy and be overcomers when we are struggling, James 4:7, “submit yourselves therefore unto God, resist the devil and he will flee”. If you want to stay holy and pure, submission to the Lord is the requirement before resisting the devil of the flesh. Romans 13:14, “But put ye on the Lord Jesus and make no provision for the flesh to fulfill it’s lust thereof”. The times I put on the Lord Jesus, I find myself safe from the things I’m vulnerable to. I am vulnerable to sin and so are you and always putting on the Lord Jesus gives us the opportunity to be guided in the right paths so as not to fall in sin. It’s a sin to be in compromising situations, live a fornicative lifestyle, watch things you know are not right, allowing our mouths to curse and swear. We cannot use the same mouth we curse with to bless also for the two cannot work together. Growing in holiness as I have said is not about perfection though that is the ultimate goal, it’s about direction. Where we can look back and say, surely there has been change, a progress. See the bible says, “walk in the Sprit” not “arrive in the Spirit” , Lord help us to grow in holiness as we strive to walk in the Spirit.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Fill Me To Over Flow

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 42:1-6, “As the deer pants for the water brooks, So pants my soul for You, O God”

One can only move because there is a reason for the move. The psalmist gives us a picture of what his hunger and thirst is like. I don’t know much about the deer’s but I believe that when they are thirsty for water, they run to find a place to drink water and they stick there until they are filled. Anyone who is not thirsty will not run around looking for water and anyone who is not hungry will also not run around looking for food. Praise be to God that we are in a place where our souls can pant after God because we haven’t had enough of Him. The Samaritan woman kept on going to the well to get the water that could only quench her thirst for a season but when Jesus appeared and talked to her about the eternal water, she began to pant for it, John 4:15, “The woman said unto Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not”. The bible also says in Mathew 5:6, “Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness for they shall be filled“. We need to hunger and thirst again for God and the things above. The bible says in Romans 14:17, “The kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Ghost”. We are not panting after the material or the natural things, we are panting after righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Ghost. We are calling on God of heaven to send His kingdom down for we hunger for the King and His kingdom

Psalm 42:2, “My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and appear before God?”. There is a person who thirst so much for God that he can’t wait to be in his presence. When the Samaritan woman was thirsty, she tried to satisfy her thirst with men in her life, tried different things. In our age, people try to satisfy their thirst with drugs, sex, drowning themselves in work, getting more of materials. Funny thing, they do temporarily. The Samaritan woman was offered the best water to fill her thirst and we too have been offered the same. I know that at times I drag to find the Lord and at times I’m not thirsty enough to really pant more to find Him. My desire and prayers is that my soul shall thirst for the living God, always desiring an opportunity to appear before Him. I cannot be satisfied with anything if He does not fill me.

One thing I like about the psalmist is the fact that he can tell he is not where he is supposed to be. He knows by what he remembers. Psalm 42:4, “When I remember these things, I pour out my soul within me. For I used to go with the multitude: I went with them to the house of God, With the voice of joy and praise…”. A place of remembrance often tips you on whether you are progressing or not, it will also tip you on whether you are drifting back or not. In his remembrance, he realized he lost the hunger and thirst he had and wanted it back. And like us, we are also brought to a place of remembrance where we see that we are not hungry for the word like we used to, not thirsty for prayer like we used to, not thirsty for the Holy Ghost conviction like we used. We become warm when we are suppose to be hot. We become satisfied with the little we have when He so has much more to give.

Psalm 42:5, “Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God, for I shall yet praise Him for the help of His countenance”. As you go through spiritual dryness, it’s easy to begin to feel down. Feeling like you have messed up big time and there is no way you can rise to the level in which you were in before. But I would pray like the psalmist and speak and ask my soul this question, “Why are you cast down?, you cant’ cry over what you lost, it’s not over until God says it’s over, rise up and put your hope in God“. God can only fill us if we are ready for to be filled. The psalmist looked at his situation and saw where he gave up and how his soul went into despair but he refused to stay in that condition. If you and I are going to thirst, it’s time to awaken the soul and speak hope into it by yet praising Him for the help of his countenance (Appearance of His face).

Hunger and thirst will cause you to change the way you think, your actions and the direction you take. Regardless of what you are into or have been to, you have a reason to thirst for more of Him again to be filled of Him. That part of you that has gone cold and has become content needs to be wakened up by you speaking to it and rising to go down to his well, river, stream. I want more so I thirst for more that He may fill me to over flow.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: My Mind Is Made Up, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Acts 16:16-34, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God and the prisoners were listening to them”

From where we left, “A mind made up is destined for greater things for everything set on their path will work for their good”. To finish these series, let’s look at some final things that happened and how we can look back and see how God takes our disappointments and turns them into appointments. Acts 16:31, So they said, “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved you and your household, vs. 32. Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house…. And immediately he and all his family were baptized“. What a divine appointment, it started as a disappointment but as time went by, all things began to work together for good and they looked at it as an opportunity. The bible is very clear about dealing with the people we call our enemies who are not in the actual sense. It says, “When your enemy is hungry, feed him”, “overcome evil with good”, “Pray for those to despitefully use you”. The reason the bible stresses the point of doing good is because, doing good has a greater ability of changing the heart cause who doesn’t want someone to good to them?. It’s as a reminder that someone cares for their well being. Doing good shuts the mouth of an evil person and soften their hearts. No wonder they say, you cannot fight fire with fire, you have to be the fire extinguisher. The prison keeper’s mouth was shut by the good deeds Paul and Silas did and immediately realized that these had to be of God and he desired the same for himself and his family. They received eternal life. I can imagine Paul limping while trying to baptize but the joy inside to reach out to someone overwhelmed the pain.

Acts 16:34, “Now when he had brought them into his house (prison keeper), he set food before them; and he rejoiced, having believed in God with all his household”. Think about this for a moment, what would happen if all the people who were really against you came to you to bless them, pray for them because they understand that you have something they don’t have? Many hearts have been changed and friendships have been built through those who were considered enemies at one point. I can therefore say confidently, doing good is contagious why? because just as one man was against Paul and Silas at one point, that meant that even his family was against them too, but now one man comes with good news, brings the same men everyone wanted in jail with the message of truth and hope, they all get saved, get baptized and rejoiced. A friendship is built, the prison keeper sets food before them, helps clean their wounds, nursed them. A mind made up will take the opportunity in his disappointments and make appointments out of them by doing good.

To close, in the morning the magistrate sent a word for them to be released, but Paul said that they should come and release them. The magistrate were so afraid because of their conscious accusing them. They had beaten and prisoned Roman citizens based on what they heard without looking for evidence. To sum it up, they made a big mistake when they put these men in prison for out of that, more souls were added to the kingdom. What they forgot was that these men were not operating on happiness but on joy, they did not understand that these men’s minds were made up to do good anytime of day or night regardless of the situation. They crucified Jesus but even at the point of His death, He was still doing good. With all You have shared and taught me Lord, MY MIND IS MADE UP TO DO GOOD NO MATTER IT TAKES!!!!

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: My Mind Is Made Up, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Acts 16:16-34, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God and the prisoners were listening to them”

A mind made up cannot be easily changed. When you and I have proved that which is good and acceptable, and perfect will of God according to Romans 12:2, then nothing, I mean nothing will be able to stop us from attaining that goal. Just to get back to Acts 16:25, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them”. It’s easy to sing when everything is going your way and it’s easy to trust God when everything is happening right but greater faith to trust and sing to God even when everything is going backwards. Paul and Silas were in pain, no doubt, instead on nursing their wounds, their minds were made up to sing hymns to the Lord anyway. The prisoners heard them do something unusual. A prison is not a place for happiness and these men were not happy to be in jail, they had joy, unspeakable joy full of the glory of God that caused them to do the un heard of. Dealing with your prison life can cause someone to look at life differently, you should be weeping, cursing and even depressed but you keep it cool because of the One inside of you. Other prisoners will begin to hear you sing a new song to the Lord. You never know what kind of impact you are making in someone’s life by how you are dealing with your adversities.

Acts 16:26, “Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were loosed“. Do you know that every time you sing a song and pray to God you are weakening foundations, chains and walls around you? It may not happen immediately but something is happening. These men were not singing and praying to be released, they realized that no matter what happens, God is still in control. They approved that which was good put it into practice. The bible says that everyone’s chain was loosed, what does this tell us, even in their afflictions their goodness still shined and someone who may have not experienced something good in their lives for long did that day. Mathew 5:16, Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father which is in heaven“. Every time you pray for someone you know, or you don’t know, your enemies and the people who use you, something in the spirit is loosening those foundations, chains and walls. Acts 16:27, “And the keeper of the prison, awaking from his sleep, seeing the prison doors open, supposing the prisoner’s had fled, drew his sword about to kill himself, vs. 28 But Paul called with a loud voice, saying, “Do thyself no harm, for we are all here“…vs. 30 and he (keeper of prisons) brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved”. It’s easier to think of revenge when you have an opportunity to get even with someone who has hurt you in the past through lies, hatred, beaten you with words but you have a chance to show them mercy and grace. When God loosed every men and opened the door, though they did not escape, God’s power was demonstrated. The jailer in turn is ready to kill himself and someone would have let him do it but remember our brothers made up their minds to serve and do good to everyone. The first thing they did, they appeared that he may not destroy his life and two, they offered him the gift of eternal life Acts 16:31, “So they said, “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved you and your house hold”. All things work together for good to them that love God and to them that are called according to His purpose, Romans 8:28 applies in this case. I bet that after it was all said and done, Paul and Silas must have looked back and said, “It was good for us to have been afflicted, that we may learn your statutes”, Psalms 119:71. A mind made up is destined for greater things for everything set on their path will work for their good and others. To finish.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: My Mind Is Made Up, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Acts 16:16-34, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God and the prisoners were listening to them”

Acts 16:16, “Now it happened, as we went to prayer, that a certain slave girl possessed with a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much profit by fortune telling”. Looking at this again, Paul and Silas are in Macedonia doing good following the Master’s footsteps. A woman by the name of Lydia had just been saved, things were going on well then they meet this girl possessed. She was being used to make money by some people. Acts 16:17, “This girl followed Paul and us, …saying “These men are the servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us the way of salvation“. First, this is an indication that the enemy knows the chosen of God, the people who have given their lives to Christ and are standing for Him. I have come to realize that the enemy knows more about who we are in Christ than we do at times and he trembles at that knowledge. This girl followed them saying the same things over and over again without repenting of her sins. Paul understood the spirit behind her and rebuked out of her Jesus Christ name. Immediately she was freed and the masters were not too happy about it. See her masters did not care about what she needed as a person, they saw her as a means to get what they wanted. I’m not surprised about people who do not want to see you to be free, excel and move forward. They will do everything in their powers to make sure it doesn’t happen to you, they will lie on you, the will back bite, they will send frustrations in your life but the good thing is that when God chooses to free you, come rain or sunshine, He will free you like He did to this girl.

Thought that Paul and Silas would be commended for the good works, nope, the masters to the young girl arrested them, brought them before the magistrates and lied on them saying they were causing trouble in the city. No one is talking about a girl who had been freed from possession and oppression by the enemy. Acts 16:22, “Then the multitude rose up together against them; and the magistrates tore off their clothes and commanded them to be beaten with rods”. Can we say that justice was served? of course not, when they accused Jesus, justice was not served either. If you look at Jesus’ situation and Paul’s, they were found guilty not by the evidence but by the majority who raised their voices. And just like they tore Jesus’ garments, they tore Paul and Silas’ clothes and commanded that they be beaten with rods, they were put in prison and a jailer was put to keep them securely. What would you do when you have done good and instead of being appreciated and commended for the good work, you get beaten with words, they strip you of your dignity and they put you in a prison (block your way of progressing) where it’s very? I have been there at times I felt that it was no use to do good when no one appreciates it.

Acts 16:25, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them”. Prison robs you of freedom, access to a lot of information and it’s degrading to make it worse, you can be in with wounds. A lot of things can be running through your mind wondering, is it worth doing good when you don’t see a return? Jesus felt it but still did it, I believe that these two men began to ponder in their hearts and thought about what compelled them to do good in the first place. And looking at the life of Jesus doing good and was still lied on, beaten crucified, these men had made up their mind to serve. Why? because their reward to come was much greater than what they were dealing with. Jesus told the disciples in John 16:33, “These things have I spoken unto you, that in me you will have peace. In the world you will have tribulation: but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world“. Jesus said that we will deal with offences, trials, tribulations. He even said that people will do evil things to His people thinking they are doing God a service. With this understanding my mind is made up, I will do good whatever the cost, I will give the best service even if I don’t receive the same for my hope is built on NOTHING LESS than Jesus, it’s all about Him. To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: My Mind Is Made Up, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Acts 16:16-34, “But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God and the prisoners were listening to them”

In the light of walking with Christ enables us to see who He is and understand that as He was here on earth everything that He ever went through, we too will encounter some if not all. If someone tells you, to be His disciple is to pick up your cross and follow Him, check out what happened to Him when He picked up His cross and you will understand what will happen to you when you pick up yours. His challenge to us is that if He did it, we too can do it, He said greater works than this shall ye do. This does not only go by what is to be done, but what we have to go through because He lives inside of us. This is going to be hard to swallow but bare with me, DON’T EXPECT TO BE TREATED ANYWAY BETTER THAN THE WAY JESUS WAS TREATED IN THIS WORLD.

What amazes me and you will agree with me is the fact that you do not get the kind of service you give. You can go out of your way to help a customer outside or within, you do everything to make sure they are helped. You do things that are not even related to you so that someone else may benefit but when you need the same kind of service, you don’t get it or you are treated worse. Ever wondered whether in such cases you should continue being doing good or what? The bible says in Luke 6:38, “Give and it shall be given unto you, good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, shall men give unto your bosom, for with the same measure you mete withal it shall be measured unto you again” and you wonder, “how come I don’t get the same measure of what I give, where does this scripture apply?. This scripture is not given to people expecting, it’s for the people who have chosen to give anyway. My primary reason for giving is not to expect (receive). Giving is required of me and it’s a good thing to do. Acts 10:38, “How God anointed Jesus Christ of Nazareth who went about doing good unto the children of men”. Jesus wasn’t doing good things to men because He wanted to gain something from them, He came to SERVE. You would think that someone who has come to serve will always be accepted, commended and liked but that was not the case with Jesus, yet He still served anyway. He went out of His way to help, I don’t think Jesus had programs and schedules as to who to serve and reach, anyone who appeared who needed help, He gave the best service they needed. He gave them even more than what they desired. He even washed the feet of the disciples when He knew that one would betray Him and many would leave Him alone yet He was still willing to serve. What an example of service to us.

In the book of Acts, Paul and Silas are in Macedonia, already the Holy Ghost prevented them from going to different places to do good unto the children of men. Paul received a vision not to go there. The Holy Ghost stopping them is not an indication that the Holy Spirit changed His mind, it’s an indication that they fulfilling the calling of going into all the world to preach the gospel and if not stopped going to a certain place, the Holy Spirit approved their move and would also empower them. These men were initiative knowing that God had such a calling in their lives. You will always be commended for being initiative by doing something right. For Paul and Silas, they knew that they were called to go into all the world and preach the gospel, they did not wait again for God to tell them to go, they just picked up their stuff and went. Because of they were initiative, the Holy Ghost led them by allowing them to preach in some places but also preventing them from preaching in certain places. Their doing the work was not to receive praises from men but to do good just as Jesus did.

Two things to present to us this morning, don’t expect to receive the same measure of what you give but don’t stop giving. Be initiative in well doing without being told and compelled

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Do you have time, by Serene Aby

content.rendered:
A very Good Morning to all “
Greetings Friends ….

Psalms 145- 17,18
The Lord is Righteous in all his ways and loving toward all he has made “The Lord is Near to all who call on him , to all who call on him in Truth ”

When I was in Primary School I learnt a Poem …

“What is this Life if full of Care there is no Time to stand and Stare ,
No time to Stand beneath the Boughs and stare as Long as sheep or Cows “
No Time , NO Time ” NO TIME ” ..

We are all running helter skleter for what ??? we have no time for any thing .. we wake in the morning ,, grab a bite , rush to work ,.work work work .. then get back home , many a times .. laze in front of the TV eat dinner go to bed ..awake .. here is another day ..and it goes on and on ……………….

..Have we questioned ourselves as to what is it that the Lord wants us to do today .???. what is it he wants of the 24 hours of the new day he has brought us into ..many do not see this new day that we have seen .. how many have slept and not woken up .!!!.

I had heard a preacher preach some time ago about tithing our Time unto the Lord at least 1/10of our Time belongs to the Lord and should be spent in the presence of the Lord .. the Great preachers and ministers of the Lord have been on their knees and in communion with the Lord for more time before they go out into the World to minister and Preach how much more we who have so many weakness .. and whose wells dry up easily we need to fill up our jars ever morning …

so one thought I want to share this morning is HOW ARE WE USING OUR TIME ??? is the way you spend your day pleasing to the Lord ???

Then coming to the word ..The Lord is righteous in all his ways … and LOVING TOWARD all HE HAS MADE .. and that includes us .. you and me ..what ever condition we are in whatever sin we are battling with he still loves us … and The word says” HE is near all who call on HIM ” and to all who call on him in TRUTH “

“TRUTH” is the important word .. many a times .. we have a problem we call on the people around us .. we call our friends … we ask our spouses , partners , colleagues , we look all around for help .. we look around for a shoulder to lean on , for a person we can trust .. but knowing that no one . really understands ..at at the end of it all is when we get back to God and we call on him .. many a times we call on him not in complete truth .. believing that he can handle that situation for us … so Lets remember when we face a tough situation at work , in a relationship , financial any area that we need help on lets first look to our Father in Heaven who already knows the words before they come out of our mouth ,, He knows all u are going through .. all u need to do is submit it to him .. and allow his will to happen … he knows your coming in and Going out ..

The Lord says ..
Come unto me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. ..
so lets go to our Father who waiting with his arms open to receive us in whatever condition we are in ..

VS 19 , 20 He fulfills the desires of those who fear him , he hears their cry and saves them , The Lord watches over all who love him, but all the wicked he will destroy “

Amen “
“Have a Christ Centered Day
and a Blessed day, Serene Aby

title.rendered: Take the Land Now, Part 3 (By Phil The Evangelist)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

As yet I am as strong this day as on the day that Moses sent me; just as my strength was then, so now is my strength for war, both ﻿r﻿for going out and for coming in. ﻿12﻿ Now therefore, give me this mountain of which the Lord spoke in that day; for you heard in that day how ﻿s﻿the Anakim were there, and that the cities were great and fortified. ﻿t﻿It may be that the Lord will be with me, and ﻿u﻿I shall be able to drive them out as the Lord said (Joshua 14:11 – 12).”

We live in a day and age whereby one will work and work for somewhere between fifty- five to sixty – five plus years and then move into retirement. The thinking is that after giving the best years to work; now, one can sit back and enjoy the fruit of those labors. However, when does one “retire” from serving the Lord? Is there an age that one should say, “Well Lord I have put my time in these many years, and now I will rest from ministry?” When Moses sent out the spies to spy out the Land, Caleb was a much younger man at the time, with much strength and vigor. At Kadesh Barnea Caleb was 40 years old and the Israelites had wandered in the wilderness for thirty – eight years, then the conquering of the Land took seven years (ca. 1405–1398 b.c.). In the above Scripture Caleb is now eighty-five years old, and says, “Now therefore, give me this mountain of which the Lord spoke in that day…” Did Caleb retire from moving forward, did he hang up his ministry belt, did he sit back and decide to rest at this point, NO! He was determined, at eighty – five years old to move forward in all that God had for him. However, sadly in this day and age I see many older folks in churches sit back reflecting on the former years, yet failing to create new memories and continuing to minister unto the Lord, and serve people now. Paul writes, “But as for you, speak the things which are proper for sound doctrine: ﻿2﻿ that the older men be sober, reverent, temperate, sound in faith, in love, in patience; the older women likewise, that they be reverent in behavior, not slanderers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things— ﻿4﻿ that they admonish the young women to love their husbands, to love their children, ﻿5﻿ to be discreet, chaste, ﻿homemakers, good, ﻿obedient to their own husbands, ﻿﻿that the word of God may not be blasphemed. ﻿6﻿ Likewise, exhort the young men to be sober-minded, ﻿7﻿ in all things showing yourself to be ﻿﻿a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing integrity, reverence, ﻿﻿incorruptibility, ﻿﻿﻿8﻿ sound speech that cannot be condemned, that one who is an opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of ﻿﻿you. ﻿9﻿ Exhort ﻿bondservants to be obedient to their own masters, to be well pleasing in all things, not answering back, ﻿10﻿ not ﻿﻿pilfering (thieving), but showing all good ﻿﻿fidelity (honesty) , that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things (Titus 2:1 – 10).” According to Paul, and in light of Caleb, when one becomes older, it is not time to just rest, because it is only in this time of ones life that one is able to pass one certain things, impart certain things, train the younger in specific things that one would not have been able to because the wisdom and experience for the most part, would not have been present to impart. Perhaps one of my most favorite testimonies about an older man serving the Lord is called “I got off at George Street.” Click here and listen soberly to the eight minute testimony- http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-8079222068794156871. WOW, wasn’t that an incredible testimony? This man was willing to do in his condition, what many are not willing to do in their “healthy” condition. Perhaps that is why Samuel said that “…The LORD does not look at the things man looks at. Man looks at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart (1 Samuel 16:6),” speaking of young David.

David wrote the famous Psalm Twenty – Three in his golden years, not as a shepherd boy in the field. After he slayed Goliath, was on the run from Saul, committed adultery made a leader over all the downtrodden and destitute in Israel, took a census, and was betrayed by Absolom, etc…then and only then did he penned the famous Psalm. Caleb was ready still to take land, “So Moses swore on that day, saying, ﻿﻿‘Surely the land ﻿where your foot has trodden shall be your inheritance and your children’s forever, because you have wholly followed the Lord my God. Wow, this blesses my heart abundantly to hear this great news that Caleb was such a great example to follow as he WHOLLY followed his God, and would leave inheritance to his children as God’s blessing upon him. His servanthood into his older age was blessed by the Lord. The older ones must wholly follow the Lord, and not just in the younger years of their lives, and must disciple the younger ones or else how will they grow, as the Great Commission has no expiration date on it. Pass this one to those in your church that are perhaps in this era of life, and have the retirement mentality, and encourage them that there is still much work to be done, and they are needed for such a time as this.

Are you looking to retire or TAKE THE LAND in your older years?
Blessings, until the nets are filled….Phillip the Evangelist <><

title.rendered: I Will Be With You

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Joshua 1:1-18, “Be strong and of good courage…”

Moses is dead, Joshua succeeds Moses by taking the mantle and lead the Israelites across the river Jordan to posses the land the Lord had given them. The Lord tells him, “As I was with Moses so shall I be with you”. Like Joshua, we have been assured the presence of God as we start the year.

In the first few verses of Joshua 1, God is giving Joshua instructions what to do, how to do it, what to possess, where to go from here, who to take with him, what will and will not befall him. He is given such a great picture of what is to come and vs. 5 comes alive to him when God says “No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life; as I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not leave you nor forsake you vs. 6, “Be strong and of good courage“. At first it looked and sounded like the Lord was just telling him what to do and knowing that what God says will happen, it was still an encouragement to him but the moment the Lord said that not only are you going to do the things I have commanded you, I am going with you to be with you. Praise God, for we can go anywhere, face any situation because we have Him with us. When He was with the children of Israel, no kingdom or nation could stop them from moving for they understood that this people were not coming in their strength Zechariah 4:6, “…not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit saith the Lord of host”.

When we have the Lord before us we know that He is the Mighty Man of war dressed for battle, Holy Lord of Host, God is He, Commander in Chief leading us to attention, leading us to the battle to crush the enemy. Isaiah 54:17, “Now weapon formed against thee shall prosper, and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shall condemn, this is the heritage of the servants of Lord, and the righteousness is me, saith the Lord”. Friends not only is God sending us, He is going with us and nothing shall stand in our way as long as He goes with us. You see if He was going with us and not helping us we will not make it, but praises be to Him for He is going with us and helping us too. See how His presence helped these people from the beginning Exodus 13:21, “And the Lord went before them by day, in a pillar of cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in the pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and by night:”.

Three times the Lord told Joshua to be strong and of good courage and the last time we hear these words is when the people of Israel spoke the same words unto Joshua after they promised to go and do whatever their leader told them to do. The Lord would speak to us this morning about being strong and of good courage why, because He is going with us. It’s like being told to be strong and of good courage for you have national security to back you up, you have the bouncer to go with you, how about trained army to accompany you but the one who is going with us is more than the these people for He is the Lord of Host. Joshua is also told not only to be strong and courageous but to follow the commandments that were given to Moses, vs. 7, “Only be strong and very courageous, that you may observe to do according to all the law which Moses My servant commanded you; do not turn from it to the right hand or to the left, that you may prosper wherever you go“. We have a promise to go with the words that proceeds from the mouth of God. “The Lord says as long as you do what I have commanded you to do, you will prosper wherever you go”, prosper health wise, spiritually, materially, wisdom wise, socially because God is the Lord of abundance.

vs. 8, “This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate in it day and night, that you may observe to according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way prosperous, and that you will have a good success“. What a commandment that comes with the promise, we have a choice here whether to get blessings or curses and the only way will be by how we choose our destiny. Joshua is told clearly how to obtain the blessings, favor, guidance, protection from the Lord, it all comes back to not letting the Book of the Law (bible) depart from his mouth in other words, don’t stop reading it, speaking it in your mouth and following what the Book says, meditate on it day and night which I would also say, think about the word and let the word be life to you. When we have done all this then we will make our ways prosperous and the good success will come our way, a proverb we all like Prov 3:5, “trust in the Lord with all thine heart and lean not on thy own understanding, in all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your path” also Psalm 119:105, “Thy word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path”, Psalm 119:11, “Thy word have I hid in my heart that I might not sin against thee”. There is something about the Book of the Law that cannot be taken lightly. Yesterday we asked the presence of God to with us, today He gives us the assurance that He will go with us.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Building By The Divine Plan, Part 3, By Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Exodus 31:6 -11“I have given skill to all the craftsmen to make everything I have commanded you : the Tent of Meeting ,the Ark of the Testimony with the atonement cover on it, and all the other furnishings of the tent-.They are to make them just as I have commanded you”

To complete these series, there was a Notification by the Government regarding very few posts in APGENCO (Andhra Pradesh Power Generation Corporation ) and my qualification was just suitable…Though many had gone for coaching to pass through the Written Examination, my God had been helping me get the right study materials ( when there were so many advicers,so many books and so on) and was indeed my Tutor to solve my doubts, Mentor to lift me in case of any fears..”Just as Mary addresses him in John 20: 16 “She turned to him and cried out in Aramaic “Rabboni “(which means Teacher ) “I will instruct you and teach you the in the way you should go; I will counsel you and watch over you.”Psalms 32:8 Yes, with experience , I can confidently say that we need to just claim this promise and He will guide us to the right path…Today, there are so many people who are unable to understand Gods will….If we have a close friend, will we not share our secrets and tell them our ways, If that is the case, why will God not reveal His will in our lives…Why is there so much confusion/chaos –in families/ workspots/ churches. Because we do not find time to hear God’s voice …There is a saying”If Satan cannot make you bad, he will make you busy” Yes, this is happening everywhere.. People do not find time for God…Work is not definitely worship for a believer,… With God’s help, we can manage our work well within the specified time targets, and that too with accuracy…Even if some error creeps in, He will enable us to overcome it…As His name suggests, He is Wonderful …Isaiah prophesies even before Jesus was born that He is the “Wonderful Counselor, Everlasting Father, Mighty God and the Prince of Peace ” God enabled me to score 82 out of 100, by which I was among the toppers and He fought the battle for me, thus helping me to perform well in the interview and group discussion. But the results were not announced. We heard that there were also attempts to bribe and buy the post (because of the benefits in the job) and also there were severe/acute political pressures and hence there was indefinite delay…through which I had to move more close to the Lord…So when I looked to Him, He answered me through Psalms 34“ How great is your goodness which you have stored up for those who fear you ,which you bestow in the sight of men on those who take refuge in you. In the shelter of your presence you hide them from the intrigues of men”.So God had comforted me that any conspiracy or plots of wicked men will not prosper since He is fighting on our behalf “The battle is the Lord’s. Without a single recommendation or influence, God enabled to me to secure the government job , with 50% hike in the salary ,with lesser time at workspot ( now 5 hours instead of 8 hours).. and I will be reporting in the new place.

Yes, with confidence ,I can reassure, God gives everything required to do the task He has assigned to each one of us because what God does is by the divine building plan that only comes from Him and accomplished by Him. What a faithful God He is.

Praise the Lord for His unfailing faithfulness….

title.rendered: Building By The Divine Plan, Part 2, By Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Exodus 31:6 -11“I have given skill to all the craftsmen to make everything I have commanded you : the Tent of Meeting ,the Ark of the Testimony with the atonement cover on it, and all the other furnishings of the tent-.They are to make them just as I have commanded you”

Now what is this “tent of meeting”which the Lord had commanded about above ..Exodus 33 clearly describes it”Now Moses used to take a tent and pitch it outside the camp some distance away ,calling it the tent of meeting, Anyone enquiring of the Lord would go to the tent of meeting outside the camp. And whenever Moses went out to the tent ,all the people rose and stood at the entrances to their tents, watching Moses until he entered the tent. As Moses went into the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stay at the entrance to his tent. The Lord would speak to Moses face to face as a man speaks with his friend. Then Moses would leave the tent but his young assistant Joshua son of Nun did not leave the tent”

Literally we may not be asked to build an ark or pitch a tent but we have to spiritually build our bodies for becoming a meeting place with God…”Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you ,whom you have received from God?”I Corinthians 6 : 19 ..So we need to build our body as the “Tent of Meeting”-a place where God can dwell …Yes, God needs to dwell there…/reside/inhabit or settle comfortably….The world cannot see Jesus Christ, rather we need to exhibit Him….God has given us the skill …He has set the conscience within us –rather the sense of right and wrong /principles/ethics …..So are we building our bodies to become a meeting place with Almighty or with Satan ? If God cannot dwell in us, Satan will do so…We are indeed a temple in which the Spirit of God dwells…”Therefore I urge you, brothers, in view of God’s mercy, to offer your bodies as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to God-this is your spiritual act of worship”Romans 12:1.

Noah struggled but built the ark , which became a blessing to many…If we also build our bodies as “the tent of meeting”in which God dwells, then we will be a blessing and refuge for many perishing souls. No one can escape with an idea they are not given the necessary skill /talent …The parable of talents in Mathew 25:15 says” To one he gave five talents of money, to another, two talents and to another one, one talent, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey …Yes, God has entrusted/delegated certain tasks for which we are accountable, each according to our ability..”Just and true are your ways”.There are so many, in dire poverty but why did God bless us like this ?How are we using our skills? There are many ways of livelihood/employment etc but how are we balancing our priorities ? Since I had to spend almost three hours in traveling for work, I had asked God”Oh Lord, you ensure that I have a job very close to my house, so that I will save time and spend time in your mighty ministry” So He answered”You cannot lay down conditions for me, rather obey me…In whatever time you are left with, be faithful and involve in my work…I will answer your prayers” So though it was quite tough to obey His voice, after a tiring day, took sometime to work in His vineyard…Though it is very less, God values everything we do…May be our human authorities do not appreciate or recognize our effort/exertion, God does…”The Lord works righteousness and justice for all the oppressed “ Psalms 103:6 Soon, God taught me how to manage the work, which I used to take 11 hours earlier , now in less than 8 hours. Yes, He is the storehouse of wisdom and knowledge and as we read in the recent devo, He is an ever present help in times of trouble …Though my colleagues stay late, God enables me to complete my work in time, which was nothing less than a miracle ……“For you make glad by the deeds Lord, I sing for joy at the work of your hands” Psalms 92 :4 to finish

title.rendered: What’s So Good About Good Friday by Phillip The Evangelist

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS. (John 19:19)

When one thinks about the concept of good, things such as a good meal, a good day, a good deal may come to mind. However, when the concept of good is used in Scripture it correlates to, perfect and holy. Christians around the world remember the culminating days of Christ’s passion with today being named, as Good Friday. What is so good about this day? Jesus is tried before the Sanhedrin, sentenced by Pilate, crucified and buried all before the Sabbath. What is so good about all of this? Put yourself back during the days of the disciples. We look through hindsight, but those that followed Jesus didn’t have that luxury at the time. I imagine that they looked with eyes of various emotions such as: doubt, loss, discouragement, distress, bewilderment, sorrow, emptiness, duress, abandonment, depression, and defeat. They heard Jesus say what was going to happen pertaining to His Resurrection, but they were two days away from seeing the fulfillment of His words. There are some incredible things that happened here.

First Jesus stands in submission to Pilate. Jesus surely had greater power and authority to Pilate. However, because of Jesus’ commitment to His Father’s will, Christ submits Himself to the Father in the Garden of Gethsemane, and thus to Pilate. Pilate thought the he was running the show, he thought he was in control. Christ exemplified that we too need a Garden of Gethsemane experience whereby we pray, “…not my will be Your be done,” and follow through with the prayer by our actions.

Secondly, Simon carried the cross of Christ. Christ was too weak to carry His own cross, so another, Simon, carried it for Him. There is nothing comfortable about a cross. Jesus said earlier to His disciples, “Mt 16:24 …”If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.” As Christians we are each given a cross to bear, and by carrying it, we become more like Christ.

Thirdly, Christ these men took the name of the Lord in vain, thus breaking the Third Commandment. The soldiers stripped Him of His clothing, scourged Him, placed a crown of thorns upon His head and hailed Him saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” The worship of Jesus became a mockery compared to times past, when many various persons Christ encountered came to Christ in sincere worship. The soldiers made not only a mockery of Christ through blasphemy, but also of all those that followed Him. These soldiers didn’t realize that the One they mocked, would be worshipped by the world one day, and the toll would be reversed as Jesus the Judge would one day judge their lives by His standard of righteousness. One soldier came to his senses on Good Friday and upon Christ’s last breath, the solider cried out, “Truly this was the Son of God!” Do you worship Christ in spirit and truth or flesh and lies (John 4:24)?

Fourthly, Jesus while he was being crucified prayed for the salvation of His murderers. Jesus prayed, “Father forgive them for they know not what they do.” Non-Christians do not know what they are doing when they mock your faith in Christ. Do you forgive them for their ignorance, and mockery? Christ exemplified how to love your enemies and commanded us to do the same (Matt 5). Stephen the first Christian martyr had the Lord’s heartbeat of forgiveness (Acts 7). Do you show love to your enemies? Is there someone you need to forgive?

Fifthly, Christ was paying the fine for the Law (The Ten Commandments) that you and I broke, in his life’s blood. “For Christ also suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust, that He might bring ﻿us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit (1 Peter 3:18).” He was the not only the King of the Jews, but John also wrote in Revelation that He is And ﻿He has on His robe and on His thigh a name written: ﻿ KING OF KINGS AND LORD OF LORDS. Is he your King, are you in His Kingdom, and do you do His will?

Good Friday, there is so much that Christ can teach us even before Sunday (Resurrection Day!) Don’t miss out on these and the many more lessons found in reading the Scripture centering around Christ’s Passion. No doubt many will pay there Sunday visit to Church on Resurrection Sunday, many out of tradition and not because they truly love the Lord. Many will gather together and eat after Church with family and friends. However, how Christians many will tell their family, friends, and even strangers about the true story of what many term Easter, and tell their neighbor why Christ died for them, and how He rose on Resurrection Sunday? The Good God made a way of escape from Hell by the blood of His only begotten Son, Jesus Christ, and all those that repent and put their trust in the Savior will surly pass from death to life (John 5:24).

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,
Phil The Evangelist<><

**** Happy Easter everyone!!

Good morning,

Exodus 31:6 -11“I have given skill to all the craftsmen to make everything I have commanded you : the Tent of Meeting ,the Ark of the Testimony with the atonement cover on it, and all the other furnishings of the tent-.They are to make them just as I have commanded you”

When God puts us on any task or assignment, He has already equipped/furnished us with ALL the necessary element or ingredients to complete/finish that particular task. Now our success depends to how best we use the same in order to accomplish the task…There are many Christians and Non Christians who still grumble that they do not have any talent or ability or expertise. But the above verse says that He had given skill to ALL the craftsmen to make everything He had commanded…If we try to do some tasks which are assigned or allotted to someone else, then definitely we find something lacking…But God has called us for something different. He has a specific plan for each of us…He has called some to be apostles, some teachers, some evangelists and so on .Our God is just and is not partial and does not show favoritism …His love and justice is exhibited by the very fact that the sun is the same for everyone and gives equal light to all, irrespective of whether he admires God or not and whether He understands Him or not…Though there are people who worship the creation instead of the Creator (Worshippers of Sun or Worshippers of Trees ,whom I met) ,God still demonstrates His patience by sending rain on all the people equally…It is never like a good rain for a believers field and complete drought for a wicked person…The very Creation speaks of His accommodative nature…So He has given ALL the people talents ..

We read of Noah, a blameless and a righteous person among the people of his time who were so wicked and they grieved/pained God’s heart …But in view of the planned terrible destruction through floodwaters on the earth, God commanded him to “Make yourself an ark of cypress wood; make rooms in it and coat it with pitch inside and out, This is how you are to build it :The Ark 450 feet long, 75 feet wide and 45 feet high” …It had to made with three decks

There was never rain till then, on the entire earth. Imagining ourselves in place of Noah, how difficult it is obey Gods command and that too amidst people, who were making fun of him, scorning his very idea, ridiculing that there was never a rain but he was building an ark for the floodwaters …He never had our authentic or dependable Bible, which could always give some previous references of such tough situations or examples or illustrations of such wonders performed by the Almighty….The only basis or the foundation for this gigantic/colossal task of building an ark was God’s voice…and nothing else…How much time/money /efforts must Noah have invested in this venture ???Not knowing the result finally. All because of his strong faith /trust in his Creator…Whatever be the opposition or whatever may be the cost involved, he was ready to do it and the final result as mentioned in Genesis 6:22 “Noah did everything just as God commanded him” This also proves that God had given the skill to do everything He had commanded.. Yes, these heroes of faith have proved to entire humanity and all the coming generations that God’s word is trustworthy….…God sent the rain ,as He had promised in the six hundredth year of his life and thus he was safeguarded from the destruction by the same ark, though everything else had perished… to continue

title.rendered: THE SUPREME SACRIFICE, Verses to Meditate on, by Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Recently on Friday, when I was meditating on the Cross, suddenly it struck to me that Jesus who was EVERYTHING became NOTHING for you and me

1. “The Prince of Glory who endured the Cross scorning its shame” Hebrews 12: 2

2. “The Most Loving who died for us, while we were yet sinners” Romans 5: 8
“The Most Holy who knew no sin was made “sin” “II Corinthians 5 :21

3. “The very author of life was killed and buried by a mere human beings” Mark 10:45

4.“The Chief Justice of the entire universe was deprived of justice”
“The Most Honorable was humiliated “Acts 8:32

5.“He who was basis of Law and Legality -“flawless in perfection” was hung along with criminals ” Luke 23:33

6.The Champion of Peace who was punished to give us peace that transcends all understanding Isaiah 53:

7.“The Radiant and Ruddy -outstanding among ten thousand who became disfigured and marred beyond human likeness that he was despised” Song of Songs 5 : 10

8.The very KEY to happiness became a MAN OF SORROWS Isaiah 53:3

9.God, who is to be Worshipped by entire mankind , was rejected and despised/thrown out

10. Liberator of humanity was oppressed/subjugated /afflicted by a mere men Isaiah 53:7
The Leader of the Universe / Victor who was led like a lamb to the slaughter and He who gave ability to speak , never opened his mouth

12. The very Creator of water be it seas or oceans died thirsty John 19:28

13. The treasure house of riches who became poor for us” II Corinthians 8:9

14. The Source of blessings who became a curse for us Galatians 3:13

15. Master of mankind who became a servant of entire humanity Philippians 2:7

16. He who came into our midst to embrace each and every one of us was sold for mere 30 silver coins

Verses supporting the above statements are given below-
1. Hebrews 12 : 2 “Let us fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy set before him endured the cross, scorning its shame”, Heb 12:2

2. Romans 5:8 “While we were yet sinners, Christ died for us”
II Cor 5:21 “God made Him who had no sin to be a sin offering for us, so that in him, we might become the righteousness of God”

4. Acts 8:32”In his humiliation, he was deprived of justice”

5. Luke 23: 33“There they crucified him along with the criminals one on his right and the other on his left”
8 Isaiah 52:14 “Just as there were many who were appalled at him-his appearance was so disfigured beyond that of any man and his form marred beyond human likeness- “
“He had no beauty to attract us to him, nothing in his appearance tat we should desire him” Isaiah 53: 2

9. “He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows and familiar with suffering”

10. “He was oppressed and afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth “Isaiah 53 :3

11. “He was led like a lamb to the slaughter and as a sheep before her shearers is silent”

12. John 19:28 “Later knowing that all was now completed, and so that the scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said “I am thirsty”

13. II Cor 8:9 “Though He was rich, yet for your sakes, he became poor so that through his poverty, might become rich”

14. Galatians 3;13 “Christ redeemed us from the curse of the Law by becoming a curse for us, for it is written” Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”

15. Philippians 2:7 “He who being in very nature God did not consider equality with God something to be grasped, but made himself nothing taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness”
