title.rendered: The Lord Is With You, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 6:11-40&7:1-25, “…The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor”

We looked at how Gideon launched his case when the Angel of the Lord appeared to him and said, “The Lord is with you” and how it did not make sense to him being that he had suffered for a while. He did not see how the Lord could have possibly been with him and I agreed with Gideon at one point until I looked deeper and realized the Lord was with him the whole time, otherwise worse things could have happened to him had it now been for God’s hands protecting him. We said, where we are going doubt, fear, un answered questions can not come with us, they are a hindrances to God’s move.

Judges 6:12, “… you mighty man of valor“, you have to realize that when the bible talked about the Angel of the Lord, it referred to the Lord Himself who took the form of an Angel to appear to Gideon. The Lord called Gideon mighty man of valor in the midst of his well versed history. He was like a little boy hiding himself from harms way not imagining himself as a mighty man o valor. Your past history is not a mystery to God, He is not even moved an inch by who you used to be after all He knows your history. If He was concerned about your past, He would have killed you after He got you saved but he did not. When you did not even know Him, He protected you, you could have died in that hospital bed, you could been crushed in that car accident, many things could have happened but He kept you. We are not better than those who have not made it this far. This is the favor of the Lord for when we were not, then we were because of what He did on the cross. If He cared for us when we did not know Him and now that He has revealed Himself to us like He did to Gideon, how much more will He care for those who know Him and are His?. If God needed someone else, He could have gone for them, but down in your need, in pain, in a state of confusion He reveals Himself. God is not a respecter of any man but a respecter of principles and that’s why in 1Corinthians 1:27-29, “But God has chosen the foolish things of this world to put to shame the wise, and God has chosen the weak things of this world to put to shame the things which are mighty; and the base things of the world and the things which are despised God has chosen, and the things which are not, to bring to nothing the things that are, that no flesh should glory in His presence”. I was never chosen because I was eloquent, strong and educated, I was chosen in midst fears and weakness and so were you. Romans 8:30, Moreover whom He predestined, these He also called; whom He called, these also He justified; and whom He justified, these He also glorified”. Moreover whom He predestined which means He preordained to which I would also interpret as He pre approved their destiny, and why pre? because God has approved people’s destiny and for the people to get to their destiny, they’ve got to be willing to get there it’s like setting a table with food before someone, you don’t force them to eat, all you do is set a table before them. Isaiah 1:19, “If you be willing and obedient, you shall eat the good of the land”. The Lord will not force anyone to their destiny, He will reveal His plan and then you have to be willing to move. This is where faith comes is Hebrews 11:1, “Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen”, it’s not the Lord hoping but we His people. So the people He predestined, He also called and those He called, He also justified, Justify here could also mean qualified for we failed the qualifying test from day one but He still qualified us anyway. Those He justified (qualified), He also glorified which I would say He talked highly off. 1Peter 5:6, “Humble yourself under the mighty hand of God that He may exalt you in due season” Mark the word HE MAY not I MAY. God will exalt you in due season. God did not CTQ (Call The Qualified), He QTC (Qualified The Called)

The Angel calls him Mighty man of Valor what the Lord is saying to him is that I’m calling you what you are not because when I am done working on you, you will be what I called you when you did not even feel like one. The Lord was going to draw out of Gideon the hidden potentials he had been reserving for a time Israel needed them the most. If you thought this was it, wait till the Lord reveals to you potentials in you He put on reserve. You still don’t know what you can be, you might have thought that under the winepress was your place and hiding from your enemies was your thing but I know God would want us to know that He already predestined each of us in ministry, family, and career but the question is are we willing to move. Willingness requires change and that is what I will share in the morning….

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The Lord Is With You

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 6:11-40&7:1-25, “…The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor”

In the book of Judges 6:11 begins by saying, “Now the Angel of the Lord came and sat under the terebinth tree which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, while his son Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress in order to hide it from the Midianites”. We all love the presence of God, His Son , the Holy Ghost and God’s Angels,. Any time when we feel like we are alone and no one cares, there is always a way God reaches out to us in ways no one else can.

In the story if you begin from the previous chapters, we find how Israel had disobeyed God and how God brought Midianites, Amalekites and the people of the East to come against them. The reason why this came to them was because of the idols they worshiped this led to some of them taken captive and while others were hiding in caves, on mountains and under some sacred tree where Gideon was found. Gideon was hiding so as not to deal with the present situation, he felt like there was nothing more to live for. He had lost hope and confidence, he came from one of the poorest and youngest families. He was hiding in shame, despair, weak, broken, rejected, abused, feeling like a failure, confused wondering where is God when he needs Him the most. Have you ever been in a situation where all you felt was a victim of circumstance and you wondered what is wrong with me that I have to deal with all these?, where is God when I need Him?, He seams to be blessing everyone else but me?, My neighbors are happy, my friends seam to get it all together, their families are not broken like mine. Ever felt like some people were getting promotions but you?, you seam to be trying very hard but they keep raising someone instead of you?, have you ever been somewhere where everything wasn’t working right?, you try to say the right thing but it comes out the wrong way?, you try to succeed but you keep failing? I know some have felt this way and that is what our friend Gideon also felt. This led him to do nothing thresh wheat under winepress. He had stopped trying, he didn’t see any future out of it and so what is left to do is sit there and call it a quit. In his dilemma, the Angel of the Lord appears, sits down under the tree and watches what Gideon is doing in his lost thoughts.

6:12-13, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to Him, and said to him, The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor. Gideon said to Him, “O my Lord, “if the Lord is with us, why then has all this happened to us? where are all His miracles which our fathers told us about,….now the Lord has forsaken us and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites”. Here is a man who had suffered for a while, the Angel of the Lord appears and tells him, “the Lord is with you“. Lord if you are with me, how come I am suffering?, if you are with me, how come I had to go through this and that?. You know what, we don’t have to feel the Lord to know He is present, the bible calls Him Jehovah Shammah which means that He is present. When you think He wasn’t there He was actually there. You may have not felt like He was doing anything but be assured He was there and in the case of Gideon, He was always there and yet Gideon did not know why I’m I saying so? If God wasn’t with him, he could have been captured, he could have been killed, greater terrible things would have happened but because God was with him, none of these happened to him. You might have been wondering where the Lord was when you broke up with your girlfriend or boyfriend, where was He when you lost your job, when you were sick, when they lied on you, when they prevented you from receiving what you know was meant for you, where was He when your parents went through a divorce, where was He???????. You did not feel Him when you needed Him and now He appears and calls you what, “mighty man (woman) of Valor”?.

I got to stop but I have to say that whenever God is going to lift someone up, the rooted issues have to be dealt with for where you are going doubts, fear, un answered question cannot come with you for they will be an hindrance to what He wants to do. Gideon is launching His complain but all he needed to understand that regardless of what he went through and had to deal with and though the presence of God was always there, he needed to appreciate the fact that He manifested himself in other words revealed Himself marking a beginning of something greater and tell you what, whenever the Lord reveals Himself, know that there is something in store.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Point Of Reference

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Sam 17:1-58, “36 Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.” 37 Moreover David said, “The LORD, who delivered me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear, He will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine”

Every Christians has to have something that they can look back to. It’s very easy at times to forget where we come from and so when we face new challenges we don’t see how in the world we will get out of them. I believe that everything in every Christian life happens for a reason and that God maybe glorified even in it.

Today we are looking at a young shepherd boy who happened to be at the wrong place at the right time. From the time he left, he had been asked to faithfully deliver food to his brothers who surprisingly were in the battlefield facing their enemies the Philistine. David was a shepherd boy attending to sheep, temporarily he become a delivery boy. Here comes this the poor, young man smelling like sheep bringing food to his brothers who are not even fighting. It’s good to be humble and be obedient when some people in the authority assign you certain tasks that might not even be our job description why? you may never know what you are setting yourself for. I know it works!!!!

David makes his way to the battlefield and all he can see is people standing far from each other with no battle taking place. To his surprise, he can hear some deep voice talking about the children of Israel. A different man is introduced in the story and his name is Goliath of Gath. He is a giant well trained and equipped to be soldier. He has so much confidence on who he is, what he has been made and what he has and that causes him to blaspheme the name of the Lord and make fun of the Israelites. If he only knew Psalm 118:8 which says, “It’s is better to rust in the Lord, than to put our confidence in man“. Then out of nowhere, Goliath sends a challenge to any man who can fight and kill him with a promise that whoever wins will make the other party their slaves. Since the Israelites don’t want to loose and they have no one to fight this man, they are left stranded. Is it amazing how we can have all the things we need for the battle, be well trained and equipped and still find something that is so much bigger than us? When we come to a halt, that’s then when God steps in and it might not be how we expected Him to show up. David listens carefully to the giant’s demands then makes an inquiry what would happen to the man who kills the giant. Read it for yourself and you will see the promise made. This lad makes a move to face goliath with God greater in Him than the giant he is about to face.

We know well that you don’t fight a lion with a toothpick, you don’t sneeze into the wind to put off a fire, you don’t go bear hunting with a cork gun and certainly you don’t send a shepherd boy to the battle field. What I’m I talking about this morning, I’m talking about having a point of reference in your life that will cause you to make a profound move in a situation that looks impossible. He is ready to challenge a man who is well trained while he is not. He is very young, this man is big. This man is well equipped with an armor, shield and sword but David is not. How will he fight and what is his weapon. Heb 4:12, “The word of the Lord is living and powerful, sharper than any double edged sword“. When we all understand where our strength is coming from and we have a point of reference, something to look back to and see where we have come from, the battles we had to face in the past, situations that were impossible but God came through for us, well we can have the faith and the courage to take face our giants. Let’s look at David’s point of 34 But David said to Saul, “Your servant used to keep his father’s sheep, and when a lion or a bear came and took a lamb out of the flock, 35 I went out after it and struck it, and delivered the lamb from its mouth; and when it arose against me, I caught it by its beard, and struck and killed it. 36 Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.” 37 Moreover David said, “The LORD, who delivered me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear, He will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.” And Saul said to David, “Go, and the LORD be with you!”. Your faith and mine are boosted by our point of reference knowing that if the Lord did it then, He can do it again for His own glory. If He delivered me then, He can do it again. He will continue to do it again and again because He is the same yesterday, today and forever more.

We know the end of the story how David took five small stones used one bring the giant down. Even though many believe that it’s the stone that brought him down, I believe that the point of reference David had melted Goliath’s heart that he had no more strength left in him. The children of Israel had points of reference from the time they were brought out of Egypt but they did not bring them to remembrance. One last thing, before David could face him, Saul tried to give him his fighting attire but David would not use them as he had not tried them. I desire to use what works for me not what the world passives to be a good fighting combat gear. If it did not work for them certainly it will not work for me. You come to me with Sword, spear, and shield, I come to you in the name that is above every name, the Lord whom you have defied and it’s because I have a point of reference meaning proof that He is able and He will.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Who Is On Your Team? by Bro. Boaz Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Life is a game with many players, teams and coaches. The aim of every team is to win. Each individual is a team and also a unit in some bigger teams. The size of the team doesn’t matter. The goal of the team does; and the goal of any serious team is winning-success. Winning the game of life requires your participation but also your team’s support. It is very hard to win alone. It is a lot easier to win when you have team members who support you and a coach who motivates you to win. Without much elaboration, let me underscore a fact of life here: team members are necessary if you want to win anything in the game of life.

Now, I have a question for you: who is in your team?

Before you try to answer that question, you may want to reflect on some of the things you have been trying to succeed at or are thinking of winning. These may include: advancement in career or education, getting married or keeping a loving and lasting marriage, raising up children, saving money for something special, developing or maintaining a prosperous ministry, initiating a project and succeeding at it, improving your performance at work, learning new skills, dealing with everyday life’s challenges that require tough decision making in uncertain environment, forecasting the future when you don’t have all the facts, or just making simple decisions about some things etc. The list could go on and on.

Do you have a team that supports you and helps you to win whatever you set your eyes on or are trying to succeed at? If you do, do you believe you have the right team members? And, are you seeking their support and advice? What about your coaches? Do you recognize them? Do you listen to their instructions? Do you involve them in your game of life so they can help you minimize your chances of loosing and maximize you chances of winning? Do you assume that you have the strength and that you can make it with nobody’s help?

I don’t know what your answers are and what your position is, as far as seeking help from your teams and coaches is concerned. But, I do know that we all need somebody to help us. That is why we have parents, spouses, children, friends, uncles and aunts, supervisors, neighbors, pastors, counselors, lawyers, professors and teachers, etc. help us accomplish our dreams and goals in life so we can enjoy a happy and prosperous life.

God recognized our need for help and that is why he made available everybody that we may need to help us. He is a team player. He operates in three persons: God the father, God the Son and God the Holy Ghost. Before His ascension, Jesus said that He would not live us alone, but that He would send to us the Holy Ghost to help us. He is a team member. Is He in your team? How about God and the Lord Jesus Christ? Do you include them in your plans and decision making?

How about others? Do you carefully identify your team for advice and support? Here are examples of people who succeeded because of support from their team:

Moses had his father-in law on his team. That saved him from potential failure as a leader and from family collapse. Jesus had twelve disciples. He also had three inner circle disciples that He confided in whenever times were tough. Together, they succeeded at founding the eternal Church of Jesus Christ. Isaac had his father Abraham to arrange for his marriage. Timothy had Paul to help him become a successful pastor and leader. Ruth had Naomi as friend and advisor on relationship and marriage plans which led to her being married to King Boaz. Samuel had his mother Hannah and Eli, the priest as his mentors and he became the first and most powerful of God’s prophets, Peter, James and John were a team in fishing business and they succeeded.

What about you? Who are the key players in your team? As for me, in order of importance, my team players are: God, my wife, my children, my parents, my brothers and sisters, Christian brethren and leaders, friends, relatives and others. I have never succeeded a lone. I have tried, but it doesn’t work May advice?

“Don’t try to succeed on your own even if it’s possible and you have the opportunity to so. Involve others to help you succeed and be willing to share with them the credit and rewards of your success.”

Listen to what the Bible says: “Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labor…woe to him that is alone…and a threefold cord is not easily broken” Ecc. 4:9-12, “Without counsel, plans go wrong, but with many advisers they succeed.” Prov. 15:22, Paul wrote to the Romans “For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end you may be established.” Romans 1:11, Jesus confirmed that we need Him, if we are to be anything. “I am the vine and you are the branches: He that abides in me and, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me, you can do nothing.” John 15:5

These scripture point to one thing; nobody can succeed at anything without being a team player and belonging to a team and having a good coach. Ask God to help you find wise, able and experienced team members and mentors to help you. Most importantly, use the natural supports that are already in place. Sometimes the grass is not greener on the other side as we are sometimes made to believe. Give help and seek help, too. You will be amazed at how much you will have “good success” in your Christian walk and life. That is God’s way and will for all His Children (Joshua 1:8).

“Our best thoughts come from others.” Ralph Waldo Emerson,

Blessings
Bro. Boaz

title.rendered: All Things Are Possible With God

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 1:1-20, “Unless the Lord Almighty had left us some survivors, we would have become like Sodom … Gomorrah”

To get us started, Psalm 20:7, “Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we will remember the name of the Our Lord”.

Has it ever occurred to you that your surrounding could change because a righteous person was there? In the book of Genesis 18:16 God had a plan of destroying Sodom and Gomorrah due to the wickedness in that land. Three Angels of the Lord appeared to Abraham who was living outside Sodom and Gomorrah and warned him of what would become of Sodom and Gomorrah. After Angels spoke, they turned to go to the city where the destruction was to take place but Abraham stayed behind to speak with the Lord and this is the first question he asked the Lord Gen 18:23, “…will you really sweep away the righteous with the wicked? vs. 24, “What if there are there are fifty righteous people in the city? Will you really sweep it away and not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous people in it” vs. 26, “The Lord said, “If I find fifty righteous people in the land of Sodom, I will spare the whole place for their sake“. One man pleading for Sodom because Lot lived in Sodom. Abraham asked the Lord again if He would destroy it if He found 45 righteous, then if He found 40, then asked if there were 30 and he asked the Lord the question until the number dropped to 10 and the Lord answered in all that He will spare the city if He found 10 righteous people living in the city. I believe with all my heart that God can do great and mighty things because there are righteous people standing for the Lord. Even in the midst of bad things people are doing, a few righteous people have the capability of making a change. We can make a change by pleading with God. Many of unbelievers will one day say Isaiah 1:9, “Unless the Lord Almighty had left us some survivors, we would have become like Sodom … Gomorrah”, unless the Lord had used some righteous people to shine in the middle of darkness, many would have not known the love of Christ and His forgiveness of sins. Christ in us is the answer to this world, Christ in us is the answer to our families and friends, Christ in us is the answer to our community, city, state, nation. You could be the only righteous person in your family and through your pleading, the Lord could spare your family without allowing them to die without Him. Isaiah 1:18, “come now let us reason together”, says the Lord, “though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow, though they are red as crimson, they shall be like wool”. Abraham reasoned with Lord, so did Moses for the sake of children of Israel and we can do the same on behalf of our family members, friends, colleagues who are not saved.

Through you, many can be reached and through you, many lives can be spared from going to hell. Everyday God gives us opportunities to affect our surrounding so let’s make use of it. I was talking to a good friend of mine sometime back and he was telling me that while they were flying one day, the plane developed some engine problems and needed to make an emergency landing, it did not look good as the engines were failing then a thought came to me, suppose they all survived because there was a righteous person on board and God was giving each of them a second chance not only to live but turn to Him. With God, all things are possible and you and I are part of the means He will make all things possible!!

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: God Can Use Anything To Accomplish His Purpose, By Sarah Susan

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“The battle is the Lord’s” Yes, in life, there are many situations, where God Himself does the war for us .He fights for us….At times, we see that when people are working against us, God warns them even through dreams

RECONCILIATION– Classic example is of Laban, the father in law of Jacob ,who was heading to harm Jacob but was warned in a dream …Jacob was running away with fear and agony from his father –in –law along with his wives, children and the acquired property since he was being ill treated. Genesis 31: 24 “Then God came to Laban , the Aramaean, in a dream at night and said to him “BE CAREFUL not to say anything to Jacob, either good or bad” We can imagine ourselves in this situation –very tensed , but God Himself intervening and warning our enemy, How marvelous it is. Yes, if we recede from fighting but allow God to do the same for us, we can see God planning and moving greatly … Usually, though we all know the verse well that the battle is the Lord’s , we take turn and try to fight it out ..But the plan may not be right and so is the timing and the approach. It may not even suit the situation correctly … If we rely on God to fight for us, we can see the results …Since Laban was warned he did not dare to do any harm to Jacob , though he was very angry .Laban mentions to Jacob in Gen 31:29 “I have the power to harm you”. Yes, though he had power and was heading to harm him, God fought the battle and finally safeguarded Jacob and everything he had….

SETTLEMENT– We see Mary ,who was only a virgin and betrothed to Joseph, to be with child through the Holy Spirit. Joseph was shocked to hear about this, since they had not yet come together. Since he was a righteous man, he did not want to expose her to public disgrace. So he had in mind to divorce her quietly . ..But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said”Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will give birth to a son and you are to give him the name ‘Jesus’ because he will save his people from their sins”Mathew 1 : 19 So he took home Mary as his wife .We can imagine the situation of Mary. She never requested someone to pacify Joseph or convince him or speak to him herself and what not. There were so many ways for Mary for fighting the life’s real battle…She completely depended on the Almighty for every minute details happening in her life …. God was mindful of the humble state of his servant and set right ,this marriage, rather home …Yes, God is capable of settling our lives, no matter how many fears /doubts arise. If we trust the Lord for our battle, we can be rest assured

TESTIMONY-Another instance where God speaks to the wife of a person in authority…….. Pilate was seated a judge and when he was about to pronounce judgment on Jesus, his wife sent for him this message “Do not have anything to do with that INNOCENT man for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him “.Yes , when Jesus was facing opposition from all sides –all the people in the area were shouting against Jesus, but this testimony gave comfort to our Lord…May be if any other person would have conveyed this message, he would not have considered. But it was his dear wife. So God gave him an opportunity to realize the greatness of Jesus before he could decide whether to release Jesus or Barabbas

GUIDANCE-Peter saw heaven opened ,while he fell into a trance, and also saw something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners. It contained all kinds of four footed animals, as well as reptiles of the earth and birds of the air. Then God corrected Peter in his thoughts saying “Do not call anything impure that God has made clean” Yes, he was guided to go to Cornelius, where he along with his friends and relatives assembled. The Holy Spirit had been poured out on all of them.

A dream may look simple but God can use it to convey his message. Even when the king himself forgot the dream he had, the mystery was revealed to Daniel in a vision. Yes, the God had used a dream as a means to warn Laban while heading to harm Jacob and to reconcile them, to show Joseph the factual situation and build the home, which was going to be shattered, to inform Pilate that Jesus was Lord and totally innocent/blameless/pure, to correct Peter so that he should go to the Gentiles to preach the goodness, to exalt Daniel before the king and his entire kingdom.

So we need worry for any situation because He can warn our enemies in face of danger and safeguard us, he can fabricate /put together broken homes, he can prove a person innocent, when the entire world is against the same and he can also correct us so that we may be used in His work ,and he can use the same dream for honoring us and for any other higher purposes. What a mighty God we serve ! Praise Him that He is the same yesterday, today and forever. We are all privileged to be children of this great and awesome God! By Sarah Susan

title.rendered: Serving Jesus on His Terms – Part 5, by Evangelist Phil Sessa

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Serving Jesus with your talents

There are so many gifted people in the world in respect to sports, the arts, philosophy, science, theology, construction, etc…. It is interesting that many that began to use their gifts in the church, at some point used it as a stepping stone to use their gifts toward the world. For example, I believe that Pop singer Britney Spears was raised in the Southern Baptist Convention, and began using her voice to sing in church. However, when one looks at her life now, the talent that God gave her has not been one that it used for the Kingdom of God, but rather for the Kingdom of Darkness. There are a number of people that have done the same thing. Why is that? Perhaps it is because there is certainly more fame and fortune outside the church, then inside. However, I would submit in light of this, it depends who one looking to serve. Everyone serves either God or Satan (although one does not need to be a Satan worshipper to serve Satan).

Recall the challenge of Joshua who turned to the people and challenged them to make a decision as read in the following:

﻿14﻿ ﻿“Now therefore, fear the Lord, serve Him in sincerity and in truth, and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the River and in Egypt. Serve the Lord! ﻿15﻿ And if it seems evil to you to serve the Lord, ﻿choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether ﻿﻿the gods which your fathers served that were on the other side of ﻿the River, or ﻿﻿the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell. ﻿ But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord (Joshua 24:14-15).” Joshua was willing to challenge people in his influence to make a decision, as to they would serve.

Once one decides to serve the Lord, one must serve Him in a manner that pleases Him, as I have shared earlier in this series. Jesus tells the parables of the talents in Matthew 25 saying, “For the kingdom of heaven is﻿ like a man traveling to a far country, who called his own servants and delivered his goods to them. ﻿15﻿ And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, ﻿to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on a journey.” Notice that the servants were called by the master, and it seemed that the master was the one that knew the abilities of his servants. Then he decided that the talents were to be distributed each ACCORDING TO HIS OWN ABILITY! Each one had different abilities, and the amount of talents was given in light of the responsibility that the master placed on the servant according to their own ability. Upon the return of the master, he would pronounce his approval or disapproval of each servant.

The first and second servants, who received five talents and ten talents, pleased the master and doubled their talents. The Lord said, “Well done, good and faithful servant; you were faithful over a few things, ﻿﻿I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into ﻿﻿the joy of your lord.” These received the joy of the lord. The servant that received one talent, however didn’t please the master. ﻿24﻿ “Then he who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you have not sown, and gathering where you have not scattered seed. ﻿25﻿ And I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the ground. Look, there you have what is yours.’ ﻿26﻿ “But his lord answered and said to him, ‘You ﻿﻿wicked and lazy servant, you knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not scattered seed. ﻿27﻿ So you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I would have received back my own with interest. ﻿28﻿ So take the talent from him, and give it to him who has ten talents. ﻿29﻿ ﻿﻿‘For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away. ﻿30﻿ And cast the unprofitable servant ﻿into the outer darkness. ﻿There will be weeping and ﻿﻿gnashing of teeth.'”

Weeping and gnashing of teeth which are terms that describe Hell, or enter into the joy of the Lord which is a term that describes heaven. Now this does not mean that one can work one’s way into heaven, because one is saved by grace, and this not of oneself (Eph 2:8,9), but one will show one’s faith by how one lives, and also what one does with the talents that Jesus has given them. Event the wicked are given talents by God, but only those that invest themselves in the Kingdom of God will be rewarded by God. One day at the Judgment (Bema) Seat of Christ each believer will be judged on various things including how one used their talents to serve God. Servants of Jesus desire to bring Him joy, because in the presence of the Lord is fullness of Joy, and the joy of the Lord is one’s strength. In the parable, the talents, are actually money.

Do you serve the Lord with your finances and your abilities as well? Are the gifts that God has gifted you with for your glory or for His? Think about your talents, how are they utilized, how do they operate in service to the King?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Phil (Evangelist, www.Soulfishingministries.com <><)

title.rendered: Not Over Until He Says So, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 5:21-43, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”

Mark 5:38, “Then He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw a tumult and those who wept loudly”. Let me point out something I said not too long ago before I go on, don’t act like you have no problem when you do. Admit that you have a problem but confess that there is a way out of it. I believe where there is an entrance, there will be an outlet, all we have to do is find that outlet. Admitting is recognizing where you are but desiring a change. Now Jesus did not come to have a funeral service, He came to turn people’s mourning into joy. Mark 5:39, “When He came in, He said to them, Why make this commotion and weep? the child is not dead, but sleeping”. Is Jesus blind to really see that this child is dead? can’t he differentiate between a live person and a dead one? well if Jesus is life, this is no match to Him, He compares it to sleeping. The mourners are looking at the natural but they are not seeing that the One who conquered death has power over death. If they could only see things the way He did. They saw the child dead, He saw it as an opportunity to perform a miracle. How I desire that the Lord would give me His eyes to see things as He sees them. When Lazarus was sick, John 11:4, says “He said, This sickness is not to end in death; but [on the contrary] it is to honor God and to promote His glory, that the Son of God may be glorified through (by) it. (Amplified). Jesus being all knowing knew in the natural, Lazarus would die, in the spiritual realm, he would sleep and He let it happen on purpose and what He would do later was to promote God’s glory and that Him as the Son of God would be glorified by it.

The problem today is that we hang out with people who don’t believe then they inject us with words of discouragements saying, “there is no way it can happen” and sooner or later we believe the lie. Jesus had the same people surround Him and He knew about that, He closed out everyone who made fun of the miracle to be done and only brought to the inner circle those who had faith. Mark 5:40, “And they ridiculed Him. But when He had put them all outside, He took the father and the mother of the child, and those who were with Him, and entered where the child was lying”. Allow people in your life who will boost your faith over the situation you are dealing with, share with them what you are dealing with, let them help you pray over it by faith for the bible says, “Whatsoever two or three shall agree on as touching one matter, it shall be done unto them by My heavenly Father“, “how will two walk unless they agree“, if we both have faith, we are in agreement.

Mark 5:41, “Then He took the child by the hand, and said to her, “Talitha cumi,” which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, arise”. Two wonderful things I have picked from this line, Jesus not only wants to do something in our lives, He wants to touch us too. Touch brings warmth and assurance and I’m not talking about warm fussy feelings. Go to the hospitals, you will find that most patients just need someone to either hold their hands or just hold them. The second thing from this line, He did not speak about the girl, but He spoke to the girl. I don’t know who can speak to a non living thing and it hears him only Jesus. However dead the situation is, if He speaks, the dead thing will hear His voice. We speak to people and animals that can hear us and they do what we say sometimes, Jesus speaks to that which does not exist or if it exists, however dead or a live, they will hear His voice. Even that which has no ears still hears His voice. I’m not even going to get to the results of what happened but just know that there is nothing impossible with Him.

What I’m I say as I conclude, It’s not over until God says so, He is a God who keeps time, see things the way He sees them, and know that there is nothing impossible with Him. Our times are in His hands and we can trust Him, the outcome is in Hands. Thank God that everything about me, in me and around me hears His voice.

Blessings
Evans

title.rendered: Not Over Until He Says So, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 5:21-43, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”

Yesterday we looked at a story of a man who came to Jesus to seek His help for his dying daughter, on their journey to reach the girl; Jesus was interrupted by a woman who happens to have needed help too. What could have been the reaction of Jairus the father of the dying daughter? We left it on this note.

The first 4 verses concentrated on the man but the next 10 verses concentrate on the woman until verse 35, “While He was still speaking, some came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house who said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”. This is not the news the father expected and whose to blame for the death of the little girl? If I asked each of you the same question, I will hear different answers. Some would blame the woman with the issue of blood because had she not stopped Jesus, Jesus would have reached and healed her on time. Some would blame Jesus for they would argue that He should have set His priorities right. Isaiah 55:8, “for My thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways My ways, “says the Lord”. To you He may have delayed, to Him, He was on time. How we perceive and look at things is not the same way God looks at them, instead of praying, “Lord see it the way I see it”, we ought to pray, “Lord let me see it Your way”. YAHWEH (YA WAY) meaning His Way and not HIGHWAY, meaning you stick with the Master without taking highways because He did not do it your way. This man had hopes when the situation was still bearable until he learnt that his child was no more, then people discouraged him from bothering the Teacher because it was too late according to man’s ways. What we call over and finished may not be what God calls it. Here are people who had changed God’s word and put a period, an indication that it was over, but He had placed a comma to show there was more. You may have thoughts that He has limited abilities based on what you’ve heard; you might think this is beyond His league. Could it be possible that Jesus decided to delay for He wanted to perform a greater miracle beyond just healing? The bigger the miracle, the greater faith is boosted. The bible says, “Whatever is impossible with man is possible with God“. Can we say He forgot? A person who is all knowing can never forget. Can we get to that level where we see God as He is and not as we perceive of Him. Jairus might have only seen Jesus as a healer and so were the people who came from his house but the bible says in John 14:6, “Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. In John 1:4, “In Him was life, and the life was the light of men“. I look at life as the ultimate thing that no man can create. God has allowed man to do wonderful things BUT creating life and restoring life from the dead is His job. If Jesus has power to give life, shouldn’t that be an indication to us all that, there is nothing impossible with Him? Someone is frustrated because they called on God when their situation was still bearable but nothing happened, please understand that God is still able, more than able for His ways and His thoughts are not our thoughts. Do you Have dreams, desires, visions, plans, hopes, love, marriage, relationships, conditions, situations that died even after you brought them to Jesus?, guess what, it’s not over until He says so.

To someone it may be over, to God it’s just the beginning for greater things, so Jesus tells him, Mark 5:36, “…Do not be afraid; only believe“. Jesus is taking Jairus back to the faith he had when he first approached Jesus. It’s faith that activates the power to do the impossible. God will do His part but you and I have to do our part by having faith. No need to be frustrated with someone else because they got their blessings before you and yet you asked of Jesus first. No need to be frustrated with Jesus because He did not come when you called on Him, the bible says, “He has made all things beautiful in His time“. Beautiful things are not disappointing things but joy giving things. Just be glad He has not said it’s over and left. Don’t put a period where Jesus put’s a comma. To finish!!

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Not Over Until He Says So, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 5:21-43, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”

In school they taught us how to punctuate sentences. A sentence can have the same wordings but how you punctuate can change its meaning. I have been misunderstood through emails by the way I punctuated my sentences to an extent that what I meant was not how it was received. With this in mind, God had given us His word, how we punctuate His word will cause it to sound how we want it to or how the Author intended for it to be punctuated. Don’t put a question mark where God puts a period and don’t put a period where God puts a comma. If there is a period, it’s a done deal we can move on to the next thing, if He puts a comma, there is a short pause for there is more to come.

Jesus as usual was going about doing good. He came to seek and to save the lost coming to and on the other hand, He was teaching and providing for His followers not forgetting healing them. On one particular day, He had just healed a man who was demon possessed and before long a man came to Him, a ruler of a synagogue by the name of Jairus. He was a Jew and if you have read different passages, Jesus being a Jew was rejected by the Jews for the bible says, “He came to His own but His own received Him not”. Again there is another passage that says, “A prophet is not honored and welcomed in His own town”, referring to His people the Jews. What really prompted this man, a ruler to come to Jesus against the odds? Mark 5:22-23, “… And when He saw Him, he fell at His feet and begged Him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter lies at the point of death. Come and lay hands on her, that she may be healed“. We see he had a serious emergency, a life at stake that if nothing was done, it would be lost. Why not ran the girl first to seek treatment elsewhere? Did he not forget that his people always had a problem with Jesus? what would people say if he went to Him? I have come to realize that when you are in need, no matter what people think or how you have always been perceived by other people, you will lay a side your pride and ego and look for help. When you know your help can be through a church, who will stop you from getting help there?

When the Master received the message, He started a journey to meet this girl. A man who had faith in Jesus to heal his daughter. Now Jesus had a great multitude after Him even with that, He left to rescue this young girl. Mark 5:24, “So Jesus went with him, and a great multitude followed Him and thronged Him”. It’s like Jairus had called 911 and help was on the way.

The first 4 verses talks about Jesus encountering with Jairus, everything seem to be going as planned, Jairus must have been excited because the Lord was willing to come but then in vs. 25, the story takes a different turn and begins to focus on someone else referred to as the woman with the issue of blood. She had heard about Jesus, she knew her condition; she was not worthy to be around for she was considered unclean. She had had her condition for 12 years, much had been spent in worthless physicians and now she had a chance to get healed. She reaches out and touches the hem of His garments, gets healed and Jesus stops. What do you think must have gone through Jairus mind? what do you think his reaction was towards the woman who had stopped Jesus from reaching to his daughter who is in bed dying? What would your reaction be if you called 911 and as the paramedics are coming to your rescue, they stop by somewhere else to help another person? This is an interruption that causes delay that opens doors to frustrations that test you as you learn patience and trust. Hope this sentence makes sense to you as it does to me. Think about this situation and connect it with yours as I continue to deal with it tomorrow.

title.rendered: God First, Other’s Second, You Third.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Kings 20, vs. 1 “In ﻿those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, went to him and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Set your house in order, for you shall die, and not live.’ “ ﻿2﻿ Then he turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord, saying, ﻿﻿“Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what was good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly”

As an intercessor, an area of prayer request that flood our prayer list is the request to pray for physical healing. Sicknesses of all kinds we hear about and bring them before the Lord. It shows us how people are sick out here and need God’s divine intervention. Most of these diseases have complicated names to which Jesus summed them up and called them the spirits of infirmities. I was reading 2 kings 20 and to my surprise, the same story almost word for word on the first few vs. appears in Isaiah 38. A few things struck me as I read and meditated on the word.

Hezekiah was sick and near death. Here comes the prophet of whom could call on God to bring healing Hezekiah however the prophet did not bring good news. He gives him a message from the Lord to set his house in order meaning write your will and let it be known to your family because he wasn’t going to live. What would your reaction be if you were in the same situation? The prediction sounded final because it came from the Lord, but Hezekiah knew God was willing to hear his appeal. Instead of being angry at the Lord and his prophet, he chose to go to God directly though the message came to him through a prophet. The only reason he could come to the Lord directly was because of his walk with the Lord, Hebrews 4:16, “Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need”.

“Then he turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord, saying, ﻿﻿“Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what was good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly”. Reading this the first time may suggest he went to Lord to plead for his healing, let me share some thoughts from this passage that blew my mind. When he began to pray, he did not ask for healing, all he did was say “remember now, my walk before you in truth, my loyal heart, done good things in God’s sight”. Hezekiah was in his prime years then comes a message his time was up. See his number one prayer of remembrance was his walk with the Lord, how his walk brought glory to God when some of the gone kings did not do what was right before the eyes of God. His greater faith in God to do great things was not so much based on His faith on what God can do but rather his faith on what God had done. As my friend Pastor Darren preached not too long ago where he said there are people who walk towards the future by faith trusting in the Lord and there are people who walk into the future backwards meaning looking back (remembering), which builds their faith as they trust God.

There are three things out of this story in sequence that touched my heart. 1. Hezekiah desired healing that he would continue to walk and glorify God on earth. 2. He desired healing not so much for his sake but for the sake of his country, his son Manasseh who was about 12 years old. If Hezekiah died, then his young son who would have no father would be the next king at young age and his rival Senacherib would boast. 3. He desired healing that he would live in his prime years. As one Christian comedian puts it, God first, other’s second, you third, hence the acronym JOY(Jesus first Yourself last and Others in between). Hezekiah’s cry to the Lord followed the same sequence.

Going back to Exodus 32, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the Israelites, they had corrupted themselves and He was ready to wipe them out then here comes Moses pleading with the Lord to spare the Israelites not primarily because it would make him look bad as a leader if destroyed but for the sequence I mentioned earlier, 1. God first- He reminded Him of how he had brought the Israelites out of Egypt with great power and with mighty hand, destroying the Israelites would have sent a bad message to the Egyptians that God brought the Israelites out of Egypt to kill them because He had no capability to save them, 2. Others- God’s promise was the Israelites to enter into the promise land, I believe Moses wanted them to make it there and his request to the Lord was to be patient with them. 3. Himself – I believe he did not want to appear as a failed leader.

The question that I should be asking myself when I am sick should not be primarily about me being healed to be healed, but a better question. If I am coming to God for healing, my question should be, 1. How best can God be glorified in my sickness and my healing, 2. How best will the healing be to my loved ones, my friends and people around who may under estimate the power of God to heal? 3. title.rendered: God First, Other’s Second, You Third.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Kings 20, vs. 1 “In ﻿those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, went to him and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Set your house in order, for you shall die, and not live.’ “ ﻿2﻿ Then he turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord, saying, ﻿﻿“Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what was good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly”

As an intercessor, an area of prayer request that flood our prayer list is the request to pray for physical healing. Sicknesses of all kinds we hear about and bring them before the Lord. It shows us how people are sick out here and need God’s divine intervention. Most of these diseases have complicated names to which Jesus summed them up and called them the spirits of infirmities. I was reading 2 kings 20 and to my surprise, the same story almost word for word on the first few vs. appears in Isaiah 38. A few things struck me as I read and meditated on the word.

Hezekiah was sick and near death. Here comes the prophet of whom could call on God to bring healing Hezekiah however the prophet did not bring good news. He gives him a message from the Lord to set his house in order meaning write your will and let it be known to your family because he wasn’t going to live. What would your reaction be if you were in the same situation? The prediction sounded final because it came from the Lord, but Hezekiah knew God was willing to hear his appeal. Instead of being angry at the Lord and his prophet, he chose to go to God directly though the message came to him through a prophet. The only reason he could come to the Lord directly was because of his walk with the Lord, Hebrews 4:16, “Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need”.

“Then he turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord, saying, ﻿﻿“Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what was good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly”. Reading this the first time may suggest he went to Lord to plead for his healing, let me share some thoughts from this passage that blew my mind. When he began to pray, he did not ask for healing, all he did was say “remember now, my walk before you in truth, my loyal heart, done good things in God’s sight”. Hezekiah was in his prime years then comes a message his time was up. See his number one prayer of remembrance was his walk with the Lord, how his walk brought glory to God when some of the gone kings did not do what was right before the eyes of God. His greater faith in God to do great things was not so much based on His faith on what God can do but rather his faith on what God had done. As my friend Pastor Darren preached not too long ago where he said there are people who walk towards the future by faith trusting in the Lord and there are people who walk into the future backwards meaning looking back (remembering), which builds their faith as they trust God.

There are three things out of this story in sequence that touched my heart. 1. Hezekiah desired healing that he would continue to walk and glorify God on earth. 2. He desired healing not so much for his sake but for the sake of his country, his son Manasseh who was about 12 years old. If Hezekiah died, then his young son who would have no father would be the next king at young age and his rival Senacherib would boast. 3. He desired healing that he would live in his prime years. As one Christian comedian puts it, God first, other’s second, you third, hence the acronym JOY(Jesus first Yourself last and Others in between). Hezekiah’s cry to the Lord followed the same sequence.

Going back to Exodus 32, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the Israelites, they had corrupted themselves and He was ready to wipe them out then here comes Moses pleading with the Lord to spare the Israelites not primarily because it would make him look bad as a leader if destroyed but for the sequence I mentioned earlier, 1. God first- He reminded Him of how he had brought the Israelites out of Egypt with great power and with mighty hand, destroying the Israelites would have sent a bad message to the Egyptians that God brought the Israelites out of Egypt to kill them because He had no capability to save them, 2. Others- God’s promise was the Israelites to enter into the promise land, I believe Moses wanted them to make it there and his request to the Lord was to be patient with them. 3. Himself – I believe he did not want to appear as a failed leader.

The question that I should be asking myself when I am sick should not be primarily about me being healed to be healed, but a better question. If I am coming to God for healing, my question should be, 1. How best can God be glorified in my sickness and my healing, 2. How best will the healing be to my loved ones, my friends and people around who may under estimate the power of God to heal? 3. How will the healing affect me personally as a Christian, as a father, mother, brother, sister, child etc. Hezekiah prayed and God heard his prayer and added him another 15 years of life, you never know what God can do with this kind of approach as we fulfill the commandment, Mathew 22 “37Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind. 38 This is the first and great commandment. 39And the second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself”. GOD FIRST, OTHERS SECOND, YOU THIRD.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: He Touched Me

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 17:7, “And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid”

Man was created with a desire to belong. And with that, man has tried by all means to be able to make themselves wanted. Many have altered who they were originally made to be into something they thought they wanted to be so as to belong, some have also gone as far as doing things to the extreme so as to be wanted or fit in. Identical crisis still affects many even today. We see it with the youths, young adults, young men and women and even the old. Today people tend to be defined not so much about who they are but rather what they have. As long as you have it, your name will excel but the moment you start loosing it, your name also fades away.

Who does not want to be needed, valued or accepted? there is a sense in each of us to want to be in a place where our opinions are valued, what we do is accounted for and not taken for granted, where we people can feel and recognize our presence. I have been to some places where I wasn’t sure whether anyone knew I was there or if they did, I did not feel my presence mattered or counted. So everyone was busy talking to their friends or acquaintances while I was there wondering whether I should have brought someone else to talk with. We all have a desire to belong.

A part from belonging, people also desire a touch. As much as this works well with the females, males too crave for it though most don’t admit it. At times people do not need things done, they just need a touch. Touch is to cause or permit a part of the body, especially the hand or fingers, to come in contact with so as to feel. It’s also to reach out to or to be in contact with. Different things touch people but nothing touches like the presence of someone you want to be there. They say that a touch is a form of healing as touching soothes, helps relieves tension, brings warmth to the body, brings security and also gives a sense of belonging. In the verse given above, three disciples were up the mountain with Jesus. In the process of time, Jesus was transfigured and a voice came from heaven to say, “this is My well beloved in whom I Am well pleased, hear Him“. God is addressing the three disciples Peter, John and James and all of a sudden they fell down to their faces and were afraid of what they had seen and heard. There will be times we will encounter with things that will bring fear in our lives at times what you and I will desire will not be a miracle but a hand that reaches out to touch us, letting us know that everything will be okay. Someone to stand by your side when all hell is breaking loose. This is the time that even if the Lord does not do anything about my situation, just His presence and touch alone is enough to pull you through.

Jesus reached out and touched them, told them to rise and not be afraid. The Lord knows what is best for us and a miracle might not be what we need, you might have prayed that God would do something different but He allows His presence to be there as comfort. If you are in a boat and the boat is rocking and feels like it’s going to sink, if the Lord is with you in the boat, you will have the confidence to face the wind cause even if He does not calm the wind, the boat cannot sink for how can God drown? His presence and touch kept me from going back, giving up, stop looking to Him. There are things I have prayed to Him to do for years. He has not done them yet, but His touch has kept me from loosing my faith. Remember the touch is not a quick thing but it takes time because as He is touching, He is restoring, fixing, massaging and getting you ready for another step. He is the Potter working on the clay periodically reaching out to touch the clay with an aim to make it into a vessel. He could speak my existence but I would rather have Him take time to touch me. He touched me and made me whole, so do you desire a touch or do you want a miracle?

FYI – I have a prayer project and need prayer warriors who would seriously pray for admissions trip to India coming up in mid February. Please advise if you are interested in praying with me in the next month and I will share with you the details.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Serving Jesus on His Terms – Part 4 , by Evangelist Phil Sessa

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Servant the Commander’s will

“Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ. 4 No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier (2 Tim 2:3 – 4).”

What types of events or activities do people train or practice for? I have had to train for sports, competitions, tournaments in order to prepare myself to compete against my opponents. How would our spiritual life change if we took our approach to practicing a sport or musical instrument and applied it to being trained in our faith? Heb 5:14 reads, “But solid food is for the mature—for those whose senses have been trained to distinguish between good and evil. The writer mentions for those whose senses have been trained to do something, and that something is to distinguish between good and evil. Each of us have come out of the world into faith in Christ Jesus if we are Christians, and we knew evil well, we loved it, we drank iniquity like water, we were dead in our sins and transgressions. After we were changed we began to see a great difference between good and evil, but yet there are still things that perhaps we still hold to things that the Scriptures consider evil. Do you gossip (1 Tim 5:13), are you a glutton (Proverbs 28:7)? Paul writes (Eph 5:3-7), “But fornication and all ﻿f﻿uncleanness or ﻿g﻿covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints; ﻿4﻿ ﻿neither filthiness, nor ﻿I﻿foolish talking, nor coarse jesting, ﻿j﻿which are not fitting, but rather ﻿k﻿giving of thanks. ﻿5﻿ For ﻿﻿this you know, that no fornicator, unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any ﻿l﻿inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God. ﻿6﻿ Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience. ﻿7﻿ Therefore do not be ﻿ ﻿partakers with them.” The metaphor of the Christian life as warfare (against the evil world system, the believer’s sinful human nature, and Satan) is a familiar one in the NT (cf. 2 Cor. 10:3–5; Eph. 6:10–20; 1 Thess. 4:8; 1 Tim. 1:18; 4:7; 6:12). Here Paul is dealing with the conflict against the hostile world and the persecution which believer’s were facing (cf. v. 9; 1:8; 3:11,12; 4:7). If you desire to serve God as your commander, then you as a good solider you will heed his leadership, his word, as He strengthens you in Christ Jesus. Yet he calls you not to take part in the affairs of this life (the evil things previously mentioned). For example, when one is gossiping at the office to you engage or disengage in the gossip, or perhaps share that you would rather not be a part of the conversion? When you are invited to a movie that blasphemes God’s name, is filled with smut and vulgarity do you accept the invitation or reject it? John MacArthur shares, “A military soldier doesn’t entangle himself, because his call to duty is completely severed from the normal affairs of civilian life, so also must the good soldier of Jesus Christ refuse to allow the things of the world to distract him (cf. James 4:4; 1 John 2:15–17) (The MacArthur Study Bible). We pull away from the things that we used to do, a replace those things by godly living, for this purpose, “[that] he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.” Recall the account of King David’s men. “David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!” So the three mighty men broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the LORD. “Far be it from me, O LORD, to do this!” he said. “Is it not the blood of men who went at the risk of their lives?” And David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men. (2 Sam 23:15-17)

David was the King that had a desire, water. He didn’t give a command, he didn’t make his request part of his men’s job description, and he didn’t have an expectation that these three men should take up the task of his “craving” for water from Bethlehem. King David was in the line of Jesus Christ as reads in Matt 1:1 “A record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ the son of David, the son of Abraham:”

Three mighty men

Out of loyal to David these men went well beyond “the call of duty.” They were brave and courageous with only three of them breaking through the host of the Philistine army after their twelve mile journey to get there. These men had to break through enemy lines, the Philistine garrison (outpost) in Bethlehem, retrieved the water, and bring it back to David. These men were not commissioned to do this task. They sacrificed their very lives not to gain clout or merit, not to be in the Israeli hall of fame, and not even to advance the victory for their army. No these men had on thing on their minds, to bring some water for their king! Why, because this is what would please the King. With loyalty and honor they risked their lives, “counting their lives worth nothing,” just to please the King to which they longed to do, even putting themselves in “death’s way,”. Haggai 1:8 reads, “Go up into the mountains and bring down timber and build the house, so that I may take pleasure in it and be honored,” says the LORD“. God is our King and desires me to please Him! Are you serving God on His terms, with the motive to please him who has called you? Make Psalm 139:23-24 your prayer this week and always, as you serve him as your highest duty, on His terms for His pleasure.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Phil (Evangelist, www.Soulfishingministries.com <><)
